<Author>amberwithwings
<Content>My Ocean View ROCKS! Disclaimer: i'm 25 and a newlywed, so half the thrill of my vacation is being away with my husband of seven months, and I would be happy if I were to arrive at a much less classy hotel, as long as I have my bikini, a book, and the beach. I'm traveling with my husband and his parents and his brother and wife, so I didn't book the trip and I'm not paying for anything. So I won't talk about the prices much. I do know that it is expensive, though. My in-laws are, well, wealthy, and this is their 5th time here. They come for Christmas every year (the place is filled with Jews from Long Island and New Jersey this time of year, which is funny. We flew all this way, and it's like being back home. They spotted a friend from Temple at the pool!)That said, this place is gorgeous! They upgraded us to an ocean view, and I love it; the view is breathtaking. The room is really clean and modern, and they have JUST put in brand-new flat screen TVs. They participate in a water saving program, so the sheets are not washed every day, which I appreciate as a green-thinking person. The food is excellent at the poolside bar, but crappy at the restaurant closer to the beach. They're about 50 feet away from each other, but the difference in quality is astounding. The staff is super friendly and the pool-side service is great. They have a cozy jacuzzi and the pool is nice although once the sun goes behind the hotel (around 3 pm) it is unbearably cold! The beach access is convenient, and such a treat. I prefer to go sunbathe all the way to the left, where the locals are hanging out. (To get there, you have to wade through the el San Juan hotel guests... and they are snobby).The wi-fi is spotty, which is making us crazy as both me and the hubby are laptop toting people. there is NO drawer space in here, just three measly drawers that I took, and a closet. Hubbs is living out of his suitcase. Other than that, no complaints!

<Author>organicisland
<Content>Fantastic! Loved it. Would go here gain. Got a great flight + hotel deal out of NYC on Priceline. This hotel is centrally located in Isla Verde which is 10mins from the airport and 20mins from Old San Juan. This really is the best part of town to stay in if you are here for more than 3 days. Else, stay somewhere in Old SJ if visiting for the first time.VERY friendly helpful staff from the moment we stepped out of our taxi. Check-in was a breeze. Great ocean view room included in package. Hotel beach was good. Probably the best in San Juan. We did not eat at the hotel as the options were Japanese and Italian. We wanted traditional food. Great places in Old SJ. Grocery store across the hotel and tons of small restaurants (noting special) and fast food places all around. Good Breakfast bets are the bakery across the street and Mi Casita.We rented a car from the Avis counter at the hotel. The lady there was very very helpful and gave us tons of great tips. The car was not any more expensive then booking online or at a local agency (I checked at Charlie's). Go to her. You'll be happy.Overall, probably the best luxury bet in SJ. The only other hotel we'd consider was the Water Club across the street..

<Author>nyc_digitaldad
<Content>Great for a quick and affordable getaway Got a tremendous deal for a quick four-nighter with my wife. After reading reviews on Tripadvisor we decided upon the Intercontinental and knew to pay just a bit extra to be guaranteed an ocean-front room, which makes all the difference.Rooms were fairly small but just fine for two people, and the king bed faces out to the ocean, which makes for great morning wake-ups.At times, San Juan felt like a sister city of NYC given how many people have emigrated to NYC from PR. Seemed like everyone we talked to had a relative or friend in NYC, or had been there themselves. Pros: - Great pool- Not too crowded even when full- Good buffet breakfast that didn't get tiring after 4 days- 5 minutes from airport - Just like home: we have many puerto rican acquaintances given that we're from New York City- Neighboring hotels are fun to visit but we were always happy that we were sleeping at the Intercontinental'Cons:- Definitely urban feel, miami beach-like.- Depending on the tides, the ocean and sand may be overcome with seaweed 2 of of our 4 days were like this.Tip: Go to Pamela's on the Beach restaurant at the Numero Uno Guest House for a truly memorable experience.

<Author>NLODanvers_MA_
<Content>Great times at Intercontinental Just got back from 5 days at Intercontinental- we had a wonderful time. Everything was excellent- beautiful pool and beach, great rooms, lovely lobby and bars and a warm, friendly staff. The only restaurant we ate at was the beach cafe- food was good and average priced. The other restaurants at the hotel were very expensive for our tastes. Luckily, the hotel is located within walking distance to many other restaurants. We ate at Lupis, Mi Casita and Outback and they were fine. Walking around felt safe and confortable. We would recommend the tour to the Rain Forest. We loved it, though the walk back from the waterfall is a bit steep and my legs ached the next few days! Took a taxi to Old San Juan and ate at Barachina's- they invented the Pina Colada and they were delicious! We would definitely go back to Intercontinental! Convenient to airport ; you do hear airplanes but was not irritating.

<Author>Jlee73
<Content>Would highly recommend Loved it !!! The outside is a little drab from the street but once you enter the resort, it is a different story. The lobby is somewhat small, but ample, the front desk staff are excellent, Katrina (I think was her name) was extremely helpful. We arrived on Saturday morning around 12pm but our room was not ready. We had lunch at the beach side cafe, pizza, burgers and stuff. the price was reflective of a higher end resort, but not too bad. Once we got in the room, it was huge in comparison to most other resorts I looked into. This is a resort to relax in, the one benefit for me was that there were not many, if at all children running around everywhere screaming. Mostly adults just lounging by the pool. The hotel also has it's own private beach area where the porter will place a lounge chair and umbrella where ever you would like. Nice touch.We also loved dealing with Hector at the concierge desk. He booked the Bio Bay tour in Farajdo (spelling?). This is a must if you are there and there is a new moon. This is a once in a life time experience, just be prepared, you have to kayak a good distance to the lagoon. But well worth the exercise. The pool area is great, a decent balance of sun and shaded areas. The pool never seemed over crowded, and chairs were amble. We had lunch at the pool (swim up) bar. I thought it was very reasonable considering it is the Intercontinental. I had the shrimp skewers and it was only $10 bucks. Now a waring, every soda refill cost. I was not used to this considering in the continental US, refills are usually free. Also I had a cocktail and was averaged price for a beach resort. What surprises me, is to read the other reviews and have people thinking that hotels are cheap. If you want cheap, stay at the Holiday Inn. You get what you pay for, and this resort is worth it. While we were there, we also look at other resorts to see about the competition. The property next door, the San Juan Resort and Casino, it is newer and glitzier, but the room are small. I would rather have a large room and comfortable bed than a shinny lobby. In conclusion, I would highly recommend this resort. The Manager Pablo personally introduced himself to us and asked how are stay was going. When was the last time a manager asked, or even cared.

<Author>lorilou88
<Content>Disappointing and Overpriced This hotel is way way overrated and overpriced. The bathroom was dated and was in need of a serious facelit. The bathtub was old and shabby looking. Considering what it cost to stay here, so not worth it! We paid for an upgraded, ocean view room and what a disapointment. The view of the ocean was great - if you could take standing out on the the little veranda to enjoy it - which was only about three feet wide! The chairs are placed sideways because they can't fit facing the water!The pool area is nice (though rather small) and looks fairly new. They need to spend some money on the rooms. They were clean but nothing to rave about, again considering the price to stay here. Forget eating or drinking at this hotel. $4 for a small cup of cofee is insane! Thankfully, my husband is from the island so we know where - and where not - to go! If you are a true urbanite, then this is the place to stay. It's on a bustling city street with a lot of people and noise. If not, go elsewhere on the island!Honestly, we would not stay here again - just not worth the price.

<Author>smakhoul
<Content>Great Hotel, 1st class service we stayed at this hotel for the first time between 12-15 october. 2007we were upgraded to ocean view room as an ambassador member. great room, very good size and fantastic view.very clean room, good house keeping. no complaints. I know that they are phaving new rooms soon, so I can imagine they should be even great as the old ones are very nice.the view is fantastic. the breakfeast is a must. it wasn't included in our rate but it's worth every cent paid for it, around 23$. so make sure you go there at least once during your stay.we didn't try any of the restaurants or room service as it was mentione dit was overpriced in other reviews.the location itself is nice near to other hotels. next door san juan hotel has bigger reception and casino. and the ritz carlton is very elegant hotel. not sure about the food but we had a drink at the bar. first class service.near by there are all the fast food restaurant like burger king, taco bell etc. also, there are few local restaurants which are average. especially lipis which had loads of great reviews but we were dispointed ( there is another lupis in old san juan as well).taxis to aiport is $11 and to old san juan is $19Old san juan is so beautiful so you should go for sure, loads of restaurants that varies in prices. not much shopping but I was told they had a huge mall which is 19 $ as well but can't remember the name at the moment.before we went we saw on the weather chanels and website that it will rain a lot and other days scattered showers. they lied. only 10 minutes rain in all the 3 days.we'll go back again for sure

<Author>Relaxin80
<Content>Pretty Nice Hotel was clean. food and drinks very expensive. Found myself running accross the street to Burger King a few times. View from room was great. Nice pool. Concierge was very helpful. The walls seemed a little thin. I could hear what my neighbors were talking about without any effort. The restaurant downstairs is a bit odd. In the morning its a walk in buffet and in the evening its a restaurant with a dress code and its very expensive. I may have bought into that and paid for an outrageously overpriced dinner if i hadn't just eaten bacon and eggs at the same table just a few hours earlier in my bathing suit. Overall I would say it was ok. very nice to look at but once i was there a few days you start to notice the imperfections. $15.00 for a drink at the swim up bar. Muy expensivo my friends. Can't say i didnt enjoy myself but i wouldnt go back.

<Author>jjb415
<Content>Both Bad and Good to Say My stay at the Intercontinental Hotel San Juan was for 2 nights on September 14, 2007, for a pre-cruise stay. I arrrived into San Juan in the late afternoon, took the fixed rate taxi to the hotel, and was greeted warmly by the bell staff as they did each and every time I entered or departed the hotel. I was effeciently and pleasantly checked into my room #1123 by the front desk clerk. This very nice service is what I had remembered from a previous stay at another San Juan hotel, but, unfortunately this is where the friendly service ended at the Intercontinental San Juan. My room, although small, was cheerfully decorated and the bed was fluffy and comfortable with the bottom sheet completely covering the matress. The small balcony overlooked the street area and airport landing traffic (no problem with noise). I immediately noticed that the room contained nice bathroom amenities and plenty of towels, but, none of the usual Room Service Menu/Service Directory/Writing Paper portfolio. The room also had an ironing board but no iron. In calling for these items, I was told that the iron would be sent up but I would have to call the Business Center for the portfolio. Okay fine. Business Center says call Housekeeping, each time being asked, Anything else I can do for you? To me, this is the most frustrating situation with Customer Service. If you haven't been able to fullfill my request, don't ask if you can do anything else. I decided it was not that important to get the portfolio. As it turned out the iron was broken, but, was replaced quickly the next day. After a very long trip, I went to bed early but was awakened by loud voices in the hallway, mistaken phone calls and knocking at the door. After falling asleep again, I was awakened again by the 3 false fire alarms mentioned by a previous review. The next night did go much better with no alarms! My room was made up the second day very promptly after leaving for lunch and the Housekeeping department was quiet and unobtrusive.As mentioned in previous reviews,the beach at the Intercontinental is very nice and the hotel has great service for guests who wish to be served while in the sun. The pool is also very nice and security is tight, making it difficult for anyone who is not a regestered guess to be admitted. The gym is well-equipped, adequately air conditioned,and has a nice view of the beach, and is open 24-hours. The ice machine on my floor worked well and always had plenty of ice.As I stay in hotels about 12 nights a month, I have to say that the young lady at check out gets the award for the worst in the world. She was curt, rude, and did not even offer to show me a list of my charges prior to charging my card. She had no change in cash to accommodate my request for small bills acting as if this was a strange request for a hotel cashier. No thank you's or offers of assistance with bags from her. All of this after waiting 5 minutes for other clerk on duty to finish her personal conversation with a co-worker.All in all, this hotel is quite a blast from the past. I fully expected to see Lucy, Ethel, Fred and Ricky pass through the lobby while on their Puerto Rican Adventure. Truely a place where my Mom and Dad would have spent their honeymoon. Not a bad thing if staff could be brought up-to-date on current standards of service in the hotel industry.  
<Date>Sep 24, 2007

<Author>Jeolive
<Content>Island thing to do I am an experienced PR frequenter. (is that a word) Nice older hotel in main strip of Isla Verde San Juan. Direct access to nicer beach on island and nice (older) designer pool. Staff attentive. Check in was ok although I had a jerk and stone faced fool who checked me in at first and told me rom would be ready in 3 hours. I came back 5 minutes later and was helpfully attended by a female clerk who check me in 3 hours before the fool said I could. $10 to airport and cross street from Charlies car Rental. Nice rooms. again older, but clean and SMALL terraces. Casino and small lounge for evening drinks. NOT A PARTY HOTEL. More reserved.Next door at the El San Juan is where the party gets jumping with a club and live music lounge. I hear the service there is bad though, so stay here and walk there for night life. American and Latino Restaurants and small mall across street for all that you forgot back home. Decent cigar shop in mall too.Best Night Club on Island: Next door at El San Juan.Favorite eatery/hangout spot: LUPIS two blocks towards airport. Live bands (top 40 and rock) cheaper booze and food. lots happening through out week and then some.Must do in PR. Visit historical places. MUST do Old San Juan. Castles, Shops, El Convento by nice church and beautiful cooper stone street leading to the door of san Juan. Nice trendy restaurants all over 2 square miles. BEST IS DRAGON FLY. Packed. ASK FOR CEASAR. Tell him Elias sent ya.Other things: For nicer beaches, golf and great hotels to visit PLUS good eats visit FAJARDO. Half hour away but totaly different sceen. Not to mention the famous rain forest near by. Easy car ride away BUT drive with eyes behind your head. BAD drivers all over.FOR THE ADVENTURERS AND ISLAND CURIOUS: Rent a car. Travel towards the east coast line pass Pinones to Canovanas then towards Fajardo. You have rainforest and Luquillo beach here. Visit all in between (beaches and eaterys)and take a boat over to Vieges or other small island from ferry landing in Fajardo and see what a beach should be. Come back and go to Ponce historical city with beautiful buildings, famous fire house and such. Travel west to Aquadilla. boat and beach town. take a short drive from there and visit LARES' center city for a look at the older ways and good ice cream of 100 different flavors. In between on main rode to Lares visit the hidin Caves of Camuey. Drive back east and stop at Arecibo and take a view from the highest point on island. Work your way back east and visit the Bacardi rum factory. Drive to old San Juan and do the walking sites mentioned above. This would take a full day if you skip the ferry to islands. Two days with the ferry to island included.Good luck and enjoy the Island.  
<Date>Sep 16, 2007

<Author>GOBOLTS_1
<Content>Best resort on isle verde Loved this resort! Had a great vacation. The intercontinental in our opinion was the best in the area. We walked to ESJ and the Ritz and we were happy we chose the intercontinental! Great pool area and beach. Like other reviews have stated food is very expensive at the resorts. We only ate once at the resort and we chose the japanese rest. ($100 for the two of us) It was just average in my opinion. One tip bring your own drinks to the pool area, they charged us $3 for a small cup of coke and $3 for a cup of water. Booked a snorkel trip on the Barefoot cat. in Fajardo and had a great day! When we return to San Juan we will definitly stay here again!  
<Date>Sep 15, 2007

<Author>stoneiam
<Content>Just another Hotel This is just your average hotel. The rooms are a good size, basically clean, but nothing special. We were annoyed to come back from the pool on our first day at 2pm, and found our room not cleaned, with no fresh towels, etc. It shouldn't happen that you have to call to get your room cleaned, it should just be taken care of.Checking in was easy, as it should be.We didn't like on a constant basis that bellhops were riding the elevators with full luggage carts. We even had a bell hop push his way onto an elevator with 10 or so people still needing to use it. Common courtesy is the guests should use the elevator first.The pool was really nice. Clean and well taken care of. Plentyful staff for drinks, with lots of towels and umbrellas in case you didn't want to bake. Would have been nice to have umbrellas for guests on the beach, but couldn't get one.Probably would go back to the Ritz (which is down the street) rather than come here again.

<Author>TheGreatP
<Content>Would go Again I was there just before Hurricane Dean with two children (14 and 11)A really nice place to stay with just a few problems ?mostly with certain staff. Would I go back? Yes. I really liked it.Pool:Not too big, but full of nooks and crannies for the children to explore. Anyone thinking of swimming laps should go to the beach. Several rocky waterfalls and small pools.Lots of deck chairs with large fluffy towels. Could use more umbrellas ?the sun in Puerto Rico is HOT!Beach:Very close to the hotel. White sand, relatively clear warm water with a little sea weed form time to time. Small waves with not very much current. Nice beach.RestaurantsHaving read that the hotel food was expensive, I always ate outside. But I did notice that the priced menus weren't available before going into the restaurant. Always a sign of high prices. Also, poolside drinks were expensive, but many people brought their own drinks to the pool.Location:Great location. On the beach with numerous cheap or moderately priced restaurants nearby. We liked the Metropole best (a five minute walk) and for lunch the Mi Casita across the road. In the same strip mall as Mi Casita was a Chinese restaurant that was acceptable and a bakery for breakfast. Also across the road are many fast food places, if you can handle that. Also a small grocery across the road.The was airport noise, but we got used to it. Wasn't very loud in the rooms.Front Desk:A mixed bag. The men were usually very helpful and polite. They normally took the time to ask questions to find out what you really needed and offered solutions or alternatives ?always resulting is a satisfactory end. The women could use sensitivity training. The ladies were very business-like and while eventually helpful, not that friendly. I don't remember any of them saying good morning or please or thank you. When checking in at 13:00, I was reminded that check in is a 16:00. I asked for a room on a high floor and was advised that she couldn't guarantee anything until the rooms were clean (RIGHT!) Then having read in Trip Advisor about some rooms that were poorly air-conditioned, I asked about those undesirable rooms and asked her not to give me something that was the subject of complaints. She indicated that if there is a problem to call maintenance and they would fix it. (RIGHT!) She worked on her keyboard and suddenly a room was available on the 15th floor (GREAT!) Strange it wasn't available 2 minutes before. She suggested that I check back later to see if it was ready. When we did, it was ready at 14:00 (GREAT!) While I wouldn't seek this young lady again for help, in fairness, she was efficient ?but being friendly and polite would have given her high marks.Another engagement with the female front desk was over asking for change for a $50 bill. With a great rolling of the eyes she made sure that I knew how inconvenient it was for her. Pulled out different folders and consulted her colleges. At the end she gave me change. But really ?how difficult is it to break a 50? The hotel has a casino, after all.Concierge:The concierge had an A team and a B team. The A team was a man who was very helpful and polite. The B team was a woman who, although polite, was very useful. I was very upset with her one night when my son went downstairs to ask for some matches for a candle, the concierge sent him to the front desk, which sent him into a bar. She sent my 14 year old into a bar! The bar apparently couldn't help him either. So I confronted the concierge and finally a manager gave me some matches. Strangely, the next day I innocently asked the concierge, front desk and bar for matches and they found them right away.Housekeeping.Missed a few things upon occasion, but kept the room very clean. Extra towels were always there and she turned down the beds. Also cleaned the room at the time requested.Curb staff:The bell hops, bag handlers, cab callers were very professional and always helpful. Mostly young guys, the always looked happy, held open doors, greeted gusts. One of the best groups I have seen. Business Centre:Nice facility with reasonable charges. The lady managing the facility was very helpful and made several good suggestions. She knew her stuff. She was also very lovely and I went back several times to use the centre just to talk to her.Room Nice and spacious, but needed to be refreshed. Small balcony that we didn't use. The walls were a bit thin and some nights we could hear people next door or the TV. Normally turning on the air conditioning drowned out the noise.There was a space under the door of the thickness of a bic pen. As a result, all the hallway noise came into the room. I don't know why hotels have these spaces and its one of my pet peeves.TV didn't have all the channels that you would expect this type of hotel to have. Also, there wasn't a listing of the channels available. That would have been helpful  
<Date>Aug 24, 2007

<Author>banoffee
<Content>Best rooms may not be as expensive as you think. I have stayed in both the regular and Club Intercontinental rooms at this property, and I can testify that paying the higher tariff for a Club room is a solid investment. The Club rooms are more spacious (except for the cramped bathrooms) and more recently refubshed than the main rooms and have more spacious balconies overlooking the pool area. Perhaps the greatest benefit and money-saver is the fact that a really fine buffet breakfast is included in the morning, as well as an excellent hors d'oeuvres buffet and open bar in the evening. Just the breakast and cocktail hour make the higher rate sensible, and that doesn't even include the fact that the Club is open all day long for soft drinks and snacks and the level of personal service by the concierge and her staff is superb. Go for it and you'll be glad you did.  
<Date>Aug 23, 2007

<Author>grumpy611
<Content>Had a Fantastic time! My wife and daughter stayed at this wonderful hotel from 8/12/07-8/17/07. It was our first vacation in San Juan Puerto Rico, and we absolutely cannot wait to go back! The hotel was everything we had hoped for and more. It's a short cab ride from the airport and we got to the hotel at 2pm. We were immediately greated warmly by several doorman, who unloaded our luggage. You'll never have to open the door to the hotel, both in and out! We originally had booked a room with a garden-view, but it was upgraded to an ocean-view on the 9th floor. The room was nice, with a small balcony. The view at night was awesome, although you did had to get use to the sounds of the many coqui's(tree frogs). At this point any stress you may have just simply melted away.The pool, swim-up bar, and jacuzzi was nice, as well as the many small waterfalls around the pool. It was never crowded, and lounge chairs were plentiful. The beach is right off the resort, and you can have someone assist you with setting up lounge chairs and umbrella. Another person came around and took orders for food and drinks-another great amenity. The food is expensive, but we decided to splurge anyway. We had ate at the resort's Japanese steakhouse, and Alfredo's(opened one week earlier). Again, it is expensive, but the food and service was excellent.We went on two excursion's-the rain forest and horseback riding on the beach. The tour guide on the rain forest was fantastic-his name was Hector, and he took us on side tours on his own. He talked to us on the mic the whole way, giving us a history lesson on Puerto Rico and its people and customs. We visited the Bacardi Rum factory also. We took a cab ride($19)to the ferry in Old San Juan, took the ferry across(I think it was $1.50 round trip), then another cab ride($3) to the distillery. The tour there was for free, and each adult received two tickets to sample free drinks. We went into Old San Juan twice. Calle Fortaleza is the main street where you can find many shops and restaurants. The architect of the old buildings and cobblestone streets takes you back in time. We ate at the Parrot Club, which was recommended by a Cigar shop merchant. You can take a cab to Plaza Colon($19)from the hotel and walk up Calle Fortaleza to Plaza de Armas. There's an area here that you can feed the hundred's of pigeons-it was amazing. An old woman was selling feed for $1, and the pigeons are walking around your feet, waiting to be fed. Lots of folks from the cruise ships frequent the area around Plaza de Armas. You can find the outlet stores here(Coach,etc.), which is located on Calle Cristo street(make a right off Calle Fortaleza)Further up a hill on Calle Cristo(past the Coach outlet store), you will find the El Morro Fortress to the left. For $5 you can visit this fort as well as the San Cristbal Fort, which is located behind Plaza Colon. It takes a few hours of exploring one fort. The difference between the two is that El Morro is much higher. All in all, the trip was great(can you tell?), the hotel was super, the people were very nice. We cannot wait to go back!I hope this review helps any future vacationers to this great resort and island.  
<Date>Aug 21, 2007
<Rating>5	4	5	5	5	5	5	5

<Author>nativetexas
<Content>Loved the Intercontinental - Alot !!! My family and I (wife, daughter 13 and son 11) just returned from a fabulous vacation. I felt compelled to write this review since we had such a terriffic time. First of all, let me tell you about this awesome property: From the moment we checked in (which took about 5 minutes) untill the time we checked out ( which took about 5 minutes) we had t the time of our lives. The hotel is situated on a beautiful stretch of beach. - Do your homework - if you go to Puerto Rico, you definitely want to stay on Isla Verde. The Intercontinental's beach is by far the best. The pool area is just about the best I've ever seen. The pictures they have online really don't do it justice. This hotel is pricy on food and drinks but don't let that discourage you. We found tons of great places to eat within EASY walking distance and they have a great little store directly across the street where we stocked up on beverages that we put into our little cooler that we took to the pool area as well as the beach without any hassle. We managed to get 2 adult full breakfast buffets included each day. Let me tell you this was the real deal!!! It was wonderful. We ate at the beach side restuarant a couple of times and it was good and not too expensive. For those concerned about being too close to the airport... It never bothered us in the least bit. We had a city view room and yes, we could see the planes landing but it was a total non-issue...The rooms were very clean and nice and we had no issues what-so-ever. I understand they are getting ready to renovate them. Most all of the rest of the hotel has been completely renovated and it is extremly nice. I would rate this hotel about a 4.2 star. This was my first trip to PR and will not be my last. Awesome destination. This is a place where you want to rent a car and go explore. You have to go to the El Yungue Rainforest. Make sure to go to Mina Falls. After you spend the morning and early afternoon there, go to Luquillo Beach. Not the Luquillo Beach park but further down (you'll understand). Also, do the Bioilluninescense close by as well by Kayaks. Also, you really, really have to go to Culebra Island and snorkel and go to Flamenco Beach. WOW... WOW!!!! The Caves on the other side of the island really shouldn't be missed either. The Intercontinental really is a GREAT place... Don't miss out...I read some to of the other reviews and after returning I can only sumize that some people are just nuts. Beautiful, Friendly Place...Happy Traveling!!!  
<Date>Aug 21, 2007

<Author>mrsjmichel
<Content>Great Time This was a family vacation for my husband, 13 year and 6 year old girls, and I. It was a nice trip and the hotel was nice. If you are not a picky person then I would recommend this to you. The beach, pool, room service and rooms were nice. We didn't splurge on the room because we never planned on being there very much. If you get a room with a city view, don't plan on sitting on the balcony. You will be lucky to get one person out there. We were so tired everynight that we never noticed the planes. They did come clean our room everyday and we were there for 5 days. Very nice towels. The staff is helpful but don't count on getting an upgrade to a room. You have to be very lucky and it does not matter how much you tip. The food is high and so so. Your best bet is to walk across the street and chose something from there. Make sure you learn spanish. 4 places that we ate they couldn't understand us, because they didn't know english. MUST DO's El Morro Castle, great history and very cheap trip, Old San Juan was great and lots of great shops. Be prepared to do alot of walking. TAKE A CAB!!!. We went to El Morro  Old San Juan on the same day and we took a cab there and back. Yes it cost $19.00 each way. It only took us 15 minutes to get there and back. There was a nice place to eat at in Old San Juan and great view. It was called Cafe Amapola. Great beans and rice! If you like to really shop then go to the Plaza Del Americus shopping mall. Again it will cost you $19.00 each way and it took us 10-15 minutes to get there. It is worth it unless you have alot of time and patience for a 45minute or longer bus ride. Be prepared to walk. It is 3 levels and I love to shop, but I never seen the 3rd level because I was sick of shopping. You will get lost there. MORE MUST DO'S ---scubba diving, my husband loves it and has been several times. He booked it with CoQui Dive and it was well worth the money and he got 2 dives at 2 different places in the same trip/day. He said it was the best he had ever done or seen. If you want to see the most breathtaking beach you must do the snorkling trip that you can book through the hotel. It is $105.00 per person. REALLY WORTH IT!  
<Date>Aug 17, 2007

<Author>DMascott
<Content>Loved the pool and the beach This hotel is near the airport, but it has a great pool and beach. The staff was very helpful and the room was clean and nice. The down side is the hotel is not conveniently located to tourist attractions. Old San Juan is a 45-minute public bus ride away, although at 75 cents, the trip is a bargain. Any side trips require advanced planning. The food at the hotel, and all the other hotels nearby, is very expensive. If pays to walk around the neighborhood and find other restaurants. Golden Bagel across the street is an excellent alternative to the hotel's way overpriced breakfast. Lupi's down the street offers Mexican cuisine at a reasonable price. Still, the pool and beach provide a terrific and relaxing vacation.  
<Date>Aug 12, 2007

<Author>AVeryPickyTraveler
<Content>The Good and the Bad I stayed at this hotel the day before and the day after a cruise I took out of San Juan. During the first stay, they upgraded me to a suite right next to the pool that was a room of the quality you would see on MTV Cribs! This was amazing! I suspect they did this because it was my first stay at an Intercontinental Resort and Holiday Inn wanted me to keep coming back. However, on the second stay, I was in a typical room ... which was nothing special.The hotel has one of the nicest pools with beach entry that you will find on the beachy section of Puerto Rico. There is a nice bar area in the middle where you can sit and have one of the weakest $9 drinks you will ever get. However there are plenty of lounge chairs to lay out on and a nice (but crowded pool.)The hotel room (I am reviewing the standard room here ... if you have the money to get a pool side suite, you will thank yourself as the suite was one of the nicest hotel rooms I've stayed in anywhere) ... had yellowish stucco walls and medditeranian style furniture. It didn't really make me feel comfortable being in there for some reason. There was a balcony that overlooked the street (they were booked up and could not move me to one that overlooked the ocean in the back). The bed was comfortable but the room just lacked style. It felt like one of those cheap Florida condos. The bathroom was small and cheap looking.The location is good if you want to be on the beach. It isn't very glamorous. It reminds me a little of Atlantic City. The casino inside the hotel is small and there are a few good (but very overpriced restaurants). There is a Palm Steakhouse and a Japanese Hibachi style restaurant. The area around the hotel is pretty run down ... if you want to go to Old San Juan where the cruise ships dock, it will cost you about $15 for a cab there. It is several miles away. The weird thing is that the airport is only 1 or 2 miles away from the hotel yet because Puerto Rico charges cabfare by the zone, you will still pay $15 to get there.The hotel overall is kept up pretty nicely. If you can talk yourself into the club lounge (Priority Club) they have great hors d'erves and an open bar! The lobby area and casino area of the hotel are fairly classy and it does feel a little upscale. However, I wouldn't be comfortable paying more than $150 - $175 a night for the hotel based on what you get. If you are looking for nightlife and the real old side of San Juan instead of the beach/pool scene ... this is not the place for you. Stay in the heart of the old city if this is what you want as this is more of a beach resort.  
<Date>Aug 6, 2007

<Author>creolegirl
<Content>Can not wait to return! We stayed at the Intercontinental for a one day post cruise stay. All that I can say is that the hotel is amazing. The pool area is great with a large adjacent beach area. We were able to drop off our luggage and pick up towels to hang around the pool until our room was ready. We booked a city view room, but upgraded to an oceanview room. It was well worth the upgrade as we were on the 16th floor. The view was AMAZING!The room itself was fine, I would just say that it needs more up to date bedspread's. Other than that everything was great. There is also a Japanese Steakhouse as well as a Ruth Chris' Steakhouse in the hotel.We will be returning with our entire family next year. The value that we paid can not be beat.

<Author>butterfly272
<Content>Would stay there again... The staff was very friendly and helpful.The hotel room was decent. No complaints to report.The pool/jacuzzi/beach was awsome. I always had a spot by the pool and never had a problem with grabing 2 lounge chairs. the pool side cabanas were most of the time always taken.The food at the outside bar by the beach was decent. I heard the food at the pool side bar was outrageous so i didn't even order from there. For breakfast, try MI CASITA which is a great resturant right across the street by the grocery store. it can get busy so don't go there expecting quick service. their lunch/dinner is also very good!we rented a car from avis, which is also located in the lobby of the hotel. with only one person at the desk, it was a bit of a wait when there were others in line. i would suggest going to Charlie's car rental which is literally a 5 min walk from the hotel (make a left and walk towards walgreens from the hotel).if you're looking to gamble, the casino is very very small!we did not eat at the resturants in the hotel since we wanted to eat something different than what we would find in the states. some great resturants to go eat at are in old san juan called aguaviva and parrot club. also one called metropol which is about 5-7min walk from the hotel.overall, i had a great time and would stay at the hotel again.

<Author>Stevennelida
<Content>Very thin walls with lots of noise from other rooms I have stayed at this property several times in the past and have never experienced the problems of my recent stay. The hotel is kept up very well and the staff is friendly and helpful for the most part. The pool is the highlight and is often filled since the beach area is only average so most opt for the pool. In regards to the noise, I stayed on the 12th floor and for both nights of my visit I had been awakened by guests on either side of my room by only normal voices. It was almost as if there was no barrier between the rooms. I would normally immeidately knock or call the room next door but since it was pretty obvious they weren't yelling, I let it go for an hour or so before calling them to let them know of the extremely thin walls and asked if they minded keeping their conversations to a minimum since I could hear every word they were saying including their breathing inbetween their words. To my amazement, my kids slept through it yet my wife and I had two sleepless nights. I would definately think twice before booking a room here again.  
<Date>Jul 22, 2007

<Author>frac
<Content>I thought it was great! My husband and I stayed her from June 29th-July 3rd. After reading all the mixed reviews, I was a little nervous but still excited b/c I am not that hard to please. Just a few main things I wanted to let you know:1) an ealier post said that the beach was nasty and had seaweed. NOT TRUE..I thoght the BEACH was beautiful, maybe the difference is the time of year, not sure.2) the El San Juan Casino next door IS bigger, but you pay more for drinks. A beer at our hotel was $4, here it was $6.50...I cant imagine what mixed drinks cost!3 )we followed the advise on a post about taking a bus instead of a taxi to OLD SAN JUAN. Glad we did, there was a lot to see. If you take a taxi, they go the highway and you miss alot. And it definetely cheaper- .75/person opposed to $19 taxi.4) Did not like MOMOYAMA. It was EXPENSIVE. Im all about splurging on a trip, but this was ridiculous. My husband and I spent $95 on 2 entrees and 2 beers and it didnt even fill us up. The portions are very small.5) WARNING- the drinks at the pool bar are actually a LOT more than the drinks at the beach bar. I had been ordering frozen drinks at the beach bar for $8. The last day we wanted to try the swim up bar. When we got the bill for 1 frozen drink and 2 margaritas on the rocks, the bill was $35.39!!! The frozen was $11(not $8) , the margs were $9/each. They auto added gratuity too-so watch out! Blew my mind since the pool bar and beach bar are both of course at same hotel 500 feet away from each other!6) 2 COOLEST BARS we found within walking distance- standing at road with back to hotel-to the LEFT: a bar called Lupi's has good mexican food and slightly cheaper beer than anywhere else we found, nice atmosphere. To the RIGHT- a few blocks down is the Oyster Bar... good seafood, We loved the shrimp bucket- 25 shrimp for $13. At home you cant even get 6 shrimp for that price! and if you are there on Monday nights, they have buy 1 get 1 free! You cant beat THAT!7) You'll notice that there's a COCKFIGHT place down the road. If you wait till it almost is over, they will let you in free. We went just to say we'd been there-sad though.8) One last thing. If you are a SMOKER, get ready to be dissappointed. There is NO SMOKING in Puerto Rico. Not in restaurant OR bars, not even the Casinos. And at El SAn Juan Hotel, you cant even smoke outside!! You have to go outside in front, then backinto a room off the side of the drive... weird! Overall we enjoyed our stay... dont believe the horror stories on this site.  
<Date>Jul 20, 2007

<Author>HappyFeet88
<Content>Great Stay, Great Vacation My Boyfriend and I stayed at the resort during fourth of July and it was great. This was our first time to Puerto Rico and will be returning very soon and staying at the InterContinental Resort again. The pool area and beach are just like the pictures. I loved lounging by the pool. The only negative thing I have to say about the resort are the food and drink prices. Everything in the resort is over priced. But the food is not half-bad. The frozen drinks are great. However, there is a place right across the street next to the grocery store and the food there is AMAZING and CHEAP! The Casino in the hotel is a little dull, but we just walked next door to the El San Juan which has a better night-atmosphere. The security in the resort is GREAT - and if you stay here, you will know what I mean the first ten minutes of your stay! Visiting Puerto Rico - The Rainforest is a must see! Hector, our tour guide, was amazing!!! Also, check out Old San Juan, it is so beautiful. I would recommend taking a taxi - it's about a 15-20 minute ride and will cost $19. However, you could always split a taxi. That's what we did because people from the resort were always going to Old San Juan, so why not share a taxi. I didn't like the bus, it only cost 75 cents but it takes an hour to get there, it's VERY crowded and it doesn't drop you off right in the heart of old san juan. I just didn't like the bus ride. Eat at cafe puerto rico and try the shrimp mofongo - one of the best meals I have ever had in my life!!! Enjoy!

<Author>ellzebeth
<Content>Not So Glamorous We stayed at the Intercontinental in San Juan just this past weekend, and I cannot say that I was impressed. We traveled with a group of 14, all of which booked rooms here. The rooms are of decent size, but the hotel itself lacks the 'glamour' I would expect of an Intercontinental property. On several occassions throughout our stay, we came into contact with the front desk staff, and not only were they unpleasant, they were abrupt and appeared to be bothered to have to answer questions. Very few times did we see service with a smile, and for what we were paying to stay there, I certainly expected at least that much. The hotel also lacks some curbside appeal, but that seemed to be the case for many of the hotels in that Isla Verde hotel zone. If we were to return to Puerto Rico again, I would not stay at this property, nor would I point anyone in the direction of it.

<Author>GaFranco
<Content>Great value Just returned from Puerto Rico, stayed 7 nights at the Intercontinental. Excellent pool, comfortable rooms, beautiful beach view, nice lobby and entry way. The best thing about this hotel is the pool. it's well shadded if you get too mych sun, but there is also plenty of sun if that's what you want. Attentive staff, beatiful landscaping, good food.The restaurant at the end of the pool, on the beach, is not managed by the hotel and the food is overpriced and inferior. Stick with ordering from the hotel. You won't be dissapointed.Drinks are extremly weak. If you want something cool and tropical, order it without alcohol and save half price. They barely put any rum in thier drinks. If you want alcohol, stick to beers, at least you know what you're getting. Beers run about $7 each, mixed drinks are $13.Main lobby is small, not too crazy, so nice to hang out without too much of the local chaos.There is a small restaurant in the Plazoleta de Isla Verde called La Casita. It serves great, cheap breakfast for less than $5 including coffe. If you stay at the Hotel for breakfast, be prepared to pay at least $20.Did not eat at the hotel restaurants. Opted for local restaurants instead.Will need to take a taxi for most of your excersions, including Dinner. There are a few nice restaurants at the Ritz and El San Juan Hotel, other than that, you'll need a cab.  
<Date>Jul 11, 2007

<Author>1snappleltommy
<Content>nice hotel, way too pricey I am staying at the Intercontinental as I am writing this...the beach and pool area are very nice, I reiterate, very nice!My room is very nice, overlooking the pool...no complaints there...However, this hotel charges 7dollars for a small box of cereal, 10 -12 dollars for drinks that I think are weak, 3 dollar bottles of water and 3 dollar cups of coffee...One of the hotel restaurants, Ciao Mediterrean, got a good write up by Frommers. This write up must be outdated! The restaurant is on the beach, which is nice, but the food is gross bar food and pricey. The 3 of us had nachos, a few drinks, a couple of sandwiches and quesadillas for 140 dollars! The manager has an attitude but our waitress was very nice.This hotel is directly next door to the El San Juan hotel and we had breakfast across the street at a strip mall everyday. The 3 of us had breakfast for 13 including tip. I am not cheap, but I just do not like being taken advantage of, which I felt I was at the hotel.As mentioned, the pool area(which would not let us bring our own drinks and wants us to buy their overpriced drinks) and the private beach are very nice. I just felt like I was getting soaked everytime I turned around!

<Author>love2traveltogether
<Content>Wonderful Stay!!! My Husband and I just returned from a 2 night stay at the Intercontinental Hotel. I have been going to Puerto Rico all of my life and have stayed through various changes of brand at the location of the Intercontinental Hotel. I have always had great service and the decor of the public areas of the hotel and the rooms were always in great shape. The Intercontinental continues to provide great service and I felt that the grounds were kept up very well. The beach is gorgeous and clean and so is the pool area. The location is great as the hotel is surrounded by many other resorts, restaurants and shops that are all in walking distance. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant so I cannot comment on that, but there are several great little local places nearby. There is a great place for breakfast or lunch called Piu Bella. It is probably a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel and the prices are very reasonable. For dinner I would highly recommend the Metropol restaurant. The cuisine is Cuban/Puerto Rican and is definitely a place you do not want to miss.

<Author>Melkazar
<Content>Fun time! Me and my new hubby came here for our honeymoon just last week!! We had a great time,,, after reading recent reviews I was very nervous about what to expect.. But the hotel was nice pleasant workers esp concierge,, And I believe it was Fernando at the front desk that gave us a FREE ocean view upgrade for our honeymoon, which saved us $80 a night!! The pool was nice, the food was good at the cafe/bar outside,, try a cuban sandwich, Its pricey so we only are there twice. The drinks are pricey also. To eat outside the hotel there are local fast food places and small eateries just across the street., Try Mi Casita across the street for PR food, my husband is PR and he loved it. Parking- we did the self park a lot cheaper than valet and the parking lot is right across the small road, (be careful ppl arent to worried about practically running over the tourists and the cross walk). Casino is small, next door and the El San Juan is a bit bigger. They seemed to have DJ's at their pool in the evening myay try that hotel next time. The hotel will give you directions to the rainforest, The largest mall in the Carribean, the bacardi factory and Old San Juan (we had a rental car) The direction arent very exact , need more of exits and landmarks to get you some places. the rainforest is nice but go early the trails are apart from each other and you need to drive up the mountian to them. But there is no big park sign like you would think to find it.. its right up a small Pr town street that you may pass right up, but dont worry youre going the right way. Its just a little diff then what you would look for at home. Also things close at 6pm, the rainforest, shops of Old San Juan, the forts in Old San Juan, the bacrardi factory,, (watch that exit also). So go early if you can, I spent my morning sun bathing and swimming. The ocean is beautiful!!! Also try Lupis to the left of the hotel its a mexican rest with some Pr flare to it. They have burgers also , cute bar and restaurant. We ate at Ruth Chris steak house at the hotel, its expensive but the steak was awesome!! Ive never had steak without steak sauce. But its about $30-50 a steak and all sides and salads are extra so be prepared.This hotel is literally a few miles from the hotel it took us 6 mins to get there and back for our flight- car rental was also so simple if you decide to do that. But driving is CRAZY!!!!! It seems theres no organization at ALL and the highways get very backed up so if youre rushing somewhere give yourself time to get there. They dont use turn signals and will cut you off like its nothing so watch ALL LANES while you drive!!Have fun, I wish I could have stayed longer!!!!  
<Date>Jun 19, 2007

<Author>T-Ruckus
<Content>Nice hotel, nicer island Stayed here for my first trip to the island and enjoyed it. The beaches were beautiful, the pool was awesome, and the rooms were pretty good too. I have to say, I was so excited for my first trip there that I could have stayed anywhere and would have love it. This hotel was pretty nice though. The concierge was very friendly and helpful (a puerto rican who grew up in canada?) and the hotel offers many fun tours at reasonable prices. I was there in November, so the weather was gloomy for most of the trip, nevertheless, it was very warm and the ocean was like bath water. The pool was very nicely designed and I made good use of the swim-up bar. The casino was alright, kinda small, but my comparisons are to Vegas and the Indian casinos back in SD. The hallway to our room had gotten wet and was being dried with huge air driers. There was a very strange odor out there. The rooms were fine though, they had not gotten wet at all. I think the hotel could use some sprucing up. All in all, I had a great time and enjoyed a very nice, clean, fun and exciting hotel, with very helpful staff. Try the Pina Coladas at the piano bar!  
<Date>Jun 15, 2007

<Author>travellover58
<Content>Needs an update My husband and I vacationed at the Intercontinental the week before Memorial Day Weekend. Let me preface this by saying that the staff at the hotel couldn't be nicer. They were polite, helpful and friendly. The room, (we had a standard) could definitely use an overhaul. The size was generous, but the furnishings were tired looking. The couch was saggy, and the bed had the same tired looking bedspread that weighed a ton. I don't understand why a hotel in the tropics would not opt for lighter, more attractive bedding to enhance the appearance of the room.The bathroom ,again generous in size, had poor lighting. Ths shower was almost dungeon like. There was no magnifying make-up mirror, so ladies, if you need that to primp, you may want to bring your own. Due to the poor lighting, I had to purchase a mirror and apply my make-up at the the desk. The pleasantness came to a streaking halt as the Friday of Memorial Day weekend was upon us. Hello Coney Island! The guests that came at that point were loud, played radios on the beach, and left their garbage strewn all over the place. I felt sorry for the staff . At that point, I was happy to be leaving the following day. That same night, our neighbors were blasting music at midnight and proceeded to deny it to the security staff that I had to call. I would go back, during a quiet week. If you are looking to relax without the NY/NJ crowd, make sure you do not going during a busy time. ( I am a New Yorker by the way)You may definitely want to try some of the local restaurnats as the hotel food is quite expensive. The nightlife at the El San Juan was a lot more lively on Friday and Saturday nights, so we found ourselves walking there in the evenings.  
<Date>Jun 7, 2007

<Author>cfed
<Content>Wonderful experience at the InterContinental!! What a classy resort! I think their biggest attribute/selling point is their employees, so I will begin on that topic.The staff here is wonderful, from the concierge to housekeeping, they always had a smile on their face and really wanted to make you feel welcome at their resort! I cant say enough about the service here, it was TOP NOTCH!! We barely had to lift a finger here, they did it all for us!! We ended up at this resort because we originally booked at the Marriott and left after a hellish firt night there. Because of our last minute change, we couldnt get into our room for a couple of hours, but they offered us a hospitality room to get situated in and change for the beach. When our room was ready, they brought our luggage up for us and even stored my husband's golf bags for us in their storage area (not at our request) so we wouldnt be inconvenienced with having them in the room with us! Our room was nicely appointed and comfortable. Bathroom was a bit on the smaller side, but it never was an issue for us. Over all we were quite comfortable in our room. The grounds here are beautiful, we LOVED the pool (it was huge)and we were even more enthralled with the beautiful BEACH!! Spots at the pool were definitely a hot commodity; I got up at 7 am one morning to jog on the beach and guests were already saving spots!! They have awesome cabana like set ups at the pool, but only about 5 of them and they were almost always taken, especially over the weekend. The pool has a great swim up bar with flat screen tvs and bartenders that are ready to serve you!! The beach is equally beautiful - the only downfall here is that you have to pay 10 bucks to rent an umbrella. But, its worth it. The sand is so soft and the water is so warm. There is also a beach bar/restaurant that serves great food and drinks...try the salads here, they are WONDERFUL!! Also, try to get Katherine as your server...she is prompt, friendly, and always smiling! We loved her!! We had breakfast in the restaurant thats on the lower level (cant remember the name) but it was delicious. They also have a cheaper, more continental like spread in the main lobby that came in extra handy with tons of fresh fruit and bagels - yum! Overall we especially enjoyed our stay here and would return again in a heartbeat!  
<Date>Jun 5, 2007

<Author>StephanieG
<Content>Just okay We had come for a wedding and got a decent rate of 185 a night. Puerto Rico in general if you stay in San Juan I dont think is a very luxurious vacation. The water is not crystal clear blue and the sand is not white like some other islands in the carribean. The drinks were priced outrageously. Lunch for 2 was 50 bucks a day. They were doing construction on the elevators so be prepared to wait. The restaurants are nothing special. There is a japanese restaurant that is very casual and small and as for Ruth Chris, you can eat that any time in the States. The pool area is clean and pretty. The service is pretty good. Its close to the El San Juan which is where I recommend going to at night. Its right next door and is a fun place to hang w/a large casino, shops and good eats. There are tons of airline staff staying here and business people which is who i think they cater to. Overall, it was not a bad stay just nothing special. I would recommend the EL san juan next door which or a different island altogether. And bring bug spray. I got bit up really bad on the beach.  
<Date>Jun 5, 2007

<Author>jimmyglen
<Content>not a bad place - they try hard We booked this hotel for just one night using pricelines name your own price. We paid $150 and they gave us a ocean view room with two beds. The rooms were nice but nothing to write home about. The bathroom is the same size as any limited service hote (H.I express etc)The pool is nice and the hot tub was very hot. The front desk was very polite. The beach is an OK urban beach. There was a lot of seaweed when we stayed but hey its the ocean so I am not complaining about nature. The hotel is located on the main drag in Isla verde and it is close to the airport. You can hear the planes but they do not blow you out. The hotel food and drinks are priced so far out of line its not funny. $10 for a frozen drink at the pool. Rum is cheap in Purto rico but if they have to blend it with ice and add juice it will cost you $10 (at least at this hotel)You can walk right across the street and buy anything you want at Ok prices. The family (local) restaurant Mi Casista had good dinners for about $10 a plate. The service can be spotty but the food at Mi Casista is yummy. We had a party of 7 and the bill was $97 with tip. The same food at the hotel would had to have been $300. The bottom line for this hotel is the price. I could never see myself spending $300 a night to stay on a so so beach in an OK hotel by the airport for that kind of cash. I can see spending that much for, lets say the Four Seasons Maui, but not here. I also saw airline pilots staying here. The must give a real price break to the airlines (?)If you need to stay in San Juan and you get a good price for this hotel then you will have a good time. Puerto Rico is just such a crowded traffic congested place that I cant see myslef coming back. If you are looking for tropical paradise then go maybe to Culebra or another island. I am sure for $300 a night there are much much better options.  
<Date>May 31, 2007

<Author>IN_Travel
<Content>Superb Beds, Beautiful Place I am fortunate enough to work for a company that allows me to stay at the InterContinental while there for work. While I agree that this hotel is pricey, the rooms are wonderful and everything is spotless. The staff is always courtesy and friendly. Let me tell you...the beds are SUBLIME!! I can't wait to crawl into bed at the end of the day because I know I will get an amazing night of sleep. The bathrooms are clean and the showers have great water pressure. The pool area is beautiful and very relaxing. There are a number of restaurants in the hotel but expect to pay a premium to eat. Breakfast is expensive but the spread is amazing. While I don't get to enjoy the InterContinental as a resort, it is very relaxing and rejuvenating at the end of a long day.

<Author>morevacation
<Content>Treat yourself to something better... I usually stay at the Ritz on business (which is actually a pretty nice place), but got stuck here.1) Location: right next to the airport. I mean right next to it. You can taxi in to old town, or use this as a base camp to see other parts of PR. Doesn't feel very tropical? I am not sure why so many hotels hug the airport....strange location to me.2) Staff: indifferent at best. Only the folks working the bar seemed sociable, friendly. Check-in was mechanical, no one smiled. 3) Facilities: nice pool area and beach bar. Beach is fine, just seems small to me. Basically everything outside is OK, everything inside has a wierd sleeze appeal. The casino (like most all casinos in PR) is depressing. Jockey early for beach chairs.4) Rooms: smelled of mildew. Temperature control was difficult' I layed on top of my comforter to sleep because with the lights on I noticed that the underneath was dirty...hairs, spots. Gross! Please, I beg managment to invest in new bed stuff! Bathroom was OK, 3 star set-up. Shower had plenty of pressure and the water was warm. As far as a tropical tourist destination folks tell me that PR can do the trick, but one needs to get away from San Juan and the airport to enjoy its beauty. This place was just a necessary stop for me, so if you can avoid it...please treat yourself to something a little more enjoyable.

<Author>belleNY
<Content>Had a wonderful time We stood in the Intercontinental from May 3 - May 7. We booked through beachdestination.com and had a great price. Arrived at the hotel at 2pm and was given a room right away. Even though check in was at 4 pm. Room was your average room not that impressive. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. I stood with my husband and 2 year old daughter. I read some reviews about the pool and the lounge chairs. I had no problem getting lounge chairs at all. I feel sorry for guest that dont know the area and dont know where to go for food b/c it can be very expensive. A hot dog and fries for my daughter by the pool was $12. We went to the mini market accross the street and stocked up goodies for my daughter. The mall accroos the street has a restaurant called Mi casita and they had a great breakfast ( service can be a tad slow) we were going there everyday for breakfast 3 orders of eggs, home fries and panakes with juice and cofee $21 with tip. Better than the continental breakfast at the hotel which was 20 pp. We had dinner at truth steak house one nigt at the hotel. I was not impressed. being from New York and having great steak house here, thougth it was over price and not that great. Over all for the right price I will stay at this hotel again. The rooms were clean and service was good

<Author>DruidHillsGuy
<Content>Not quite a 4 star, but decent enough. Reading the Trip Advisor reviews prior to going helped to set my level of expectation. Most of the reviewers are right on the money. The hotel is not perfect, but for the price, just fine by me. Traveling with my wife and two kids, we had plenty to do and see.Positives: I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. Our housekeeper was friendly and kept us supplied with extra towels. Tipped her well my last day. Location is good. $20 bucks via taxi to Old San Juan, great mom and pop restaurant across the street, Mi Casita. Negatives: The cabanas are being reserved at 5:00 in the morning. I'm not kidding. Went down one morning at 6:15 (the Starbucks is at the hotel next door) and all of the cabanas were taken. Be prepared if you want to hang at the pool all day. Speaking of the pool, the water could have been a touch clearer. If you don't have a pool you probably won't notice it. Something that could be readily addressed. Food and drinks around the pool area are offensively priced. 2 drinks, 2 sandwiches, $50 bucks. One other thing, just to be aware of. The hotel casino is open until 4:00 am. That means doors are slamming shut in the hallways around 4:15....everyday. There really not a whole lot that can be done, other than to ask folks to not let it slam shut. Oh well.All in all a pretty decent trip for the buck. Like I said, this is not a 4 star in my opinion.....a high 3 star trying hard to move into the 4 range. I'd go back, if the price was right. So, temper your expectations, read the other reviews, and enjoy yourself, you're on vacation!  
<Date>Apr 17, 2007

<Author>Billpcti
<Content>Enjoyed this hotel Just spent five days at the Intercontinental and had an excellent experience. Hotel itself is 3.5-4 stars, staff is excellent, food is over priced but where isn't it on an island. Be clear this is not a Four Seasons or a Ritz; but it provides an enjoyable vacation complete with the amenities which most of us expect. Beach is pretty but seaweed is a problem near the shoreline; venture out a bit and it goes away. Pools are very nice and well kept. Expect the beach to be pristine and beautiful as can be and you're setting yourself up for disappointment. Restaurants are good, location is central to other activites. I'd recommend renting a car for sightseeing. Price is right; enjoy.

<Author>writingiseasy
<Content>Fantastic Experience  The airlines put me up at the Intercontinental after a missed connection so - obviously - I had not planned to stay at this hotel, nor in San Juan at all. Lucky for me, the 24 hrs I spent at this hotel turned out to be the of my larger Caribbean vacation. The staffwas wonderful, polite and accomodating. The pool was beautiful and well-maintained and there was someone ready to set out a chaise on the beach for me when I wanted to soak in the ocean instead. There isconstruction near the pool but you can avoid being distracted by it by setting up camp near the waterfall (drowns the noise) or on the other side of the pool. Not a big deal. I lunched at the poolside barand the waitress was so warm and welcoming that I never wanted lunch to end. The concierge even gave me match-vouchers to use at the blackjack tables just because I mentioned that I was excited abt the casino. I heard that the casino next door at the El San Juan is nicer, but I had such a good time during my unexpected stay that I never considered leaving the premises for a second, until I had to return to the airport the next night for my re-booked flight. I will definitely go back for a weekend away. It's two seconds from the airport and the perfect spot to get some sun.

<Content>Great service I really thought the service here was great. We were able to check in at 10am in the morning! granted we had a room that faced the airplanes landing... <Author>aMUSEher
<Content>It is what it is My college-age daughters and I were looking for a fast and easy get-away for some well-deserved RR . Our stay was: Thursday to Monday over St. Patrick's Day weekend. San Juan is a relatively quick and direct flight from NJ, no passports required, so off we went. Upon arrival, it seemed to me that San Juan is still caught in the 1960's and has never really progressed into the new millenium., I was there in 1968 and it all looked exactly the same. The hotel was 10 minutes from the airport, so expect lots of air-traffic noise, but you travel to the resort quickly by cab, so no long uncomfortable van rides. Our room was average-to-below average in size and style, but was clean.and did not smell. Although we had run of the house we ended up facing the street on the 7th floor. The landing path for air traffic.was our view. We only stayed in our room to sleep, so it wasn't the end of the world, however I do enjoy hearing the waves at night through open windows when staying at an ocean-side resort. and missed that feature. There is a wing of newer rooms that looked really nice, all facing the pool area. Apparenlty these were fully booked when we were there. If you have a cloice and the budget, book one of them.The weather was perfect everyday. The beach, however, is called the Emerald Isle for a specific reason: the green seaweed. The beach, in my opinion, is unswimmable and also smelly due to the seaweed drying in the sun, so it is not even very walkable. The seaweed extends the full length of the beach, well-beyond the hotel's boundaries. If you want a beautiful beach and like to swim in the ocean, don't go here. The pool was lovely. There is one small area that is deep for swimming, the other areas are about 3' deep. Lots of little waterfalls (great for aqua massage) and a swim-up bar. The bar served well-made and strong, albeit expensive, drinks. If you plan on eating and drinking solely in the hotel figure on spending quite a lot of money ( hot breakfast for 3 averaged $70; lunch, with drinks $100; dinners was always in excess of $100, with the exception of the sushi house, where my one daughter and I had maki rolls, wine and dessert one evening for under $50.). A Walgreen's (open 24/7) down the street ( within easy walking distance) sells spring water, I'd suggest you stock up, unless you want to pay $4 for an 8oz bottle. Lots of fast food type places are within easy walking distance. We did not go to any of them.The staff at the hotel was wonderful. Always ready to assist. We prefer iced coffee in the mornings and the wait-staff made sure we had it just to our liking every morning. The concierge service was exceptionally helpful and kind. If my goal had been a luxurious beachy Caribbean vacation...this would not be the place to go. We wanted quick and easy 4 days in the sun by a pool with good drinks and a pool-side lounge to sit and read on, comfortable enough to encourage naps. For this purpose: the Intercontinental was perfect. It was also spring-break and the hotel was NOT filled with rowdy party kids: a plus. We did go to Ajillo Mojillo for traditional Puerto Rican cuisine and it was really good, but know in advance that one entree can easily serve two people and the sangria is very sweet. They make an excellent Mojito.The El San Juan right next door to the Intercontinental has quite an impressive lobby and bar and an interesting little network of shops...worth a quick trip to explore if you get bored. We had an uneventful trip and arrived home tanned and relaxed, so it was well worth it.. I doubt that I will ever plan a return visit to this urban-based hotel. Wishing you safe and happy travels!  
<Date>Mar 24, 2007

<Author>azuel

<Author>Ihave2kids
<Content>Great stay, they do a nice job! I was very impressed with the intercontinental. The staff was excellent and very helpful. RUTH CHRIS steakhouse was terrific and right there. 19$ cab ride to old san juan wasn't cheap but DON'T take the bus- they said it would take 40 minutes and it took 1.2 hours! Casino was very nice.... Minibar a rip off as expected. Few people with kids looked like they were having a good time.

<Author>wasif20
<Content>Wonderful place, nice staff, great location, beautiful beach. The lobby was very impressive. Staff was wonderful. Access to the beach was free, there were always plenty of chairs and towels (also free) and it was never overcrowded. The beach bar had some nice appetizers. It was nice to sit there, eat and relax. A jet ski rental place was a 2 minute walk down the beach. Driving was very easy in Puerto Rico, no different than the Continental US and the concierge was excellent with directions and recommendations for restaurants and things to do. The Japanese restaurant was pretty good - hibachi grill style. Reasonable prices - around $30 per person.Parking was extra, about $11 a night, including in and out. Not too easy to find a spot, especially at night when the Casino crowd rolled in. We got a junior suite that was very clean and spacious but surprisingly no bathtub, only a small cramped shower.

<Author>tnova
<Content>A great time in PR Not sure where the negative people stayed but I know I stayed at the InterContinental San Juan Resort, Spa  Casino. It would be really helpful if people rated a hotel, service and their overall stay with a little more objectivity.We just returned from 8 days and 7 nights at the IC and had a wonderful time. Here's my objective ratings based upon numerous stays at hotels ranging from the Four Seasons to Holiday Inn Express.The InterContinental San Juan Resort, Spa  Casino is not a Four Seasons but then again I did not pay Four Seasons rates. It also not a Holiday inn Express - the IC is much better.The reasons people go to the Caribbean - sun and fun!Weather 4.5 stars - rained one day with a few showers on two other days (no big deal). Other than that the weather was outstanding - not too hot just right.Pool - 5 stars - 99.5% complete with a little grout sealing being performed, however, it was not intrusive at all. We had as many towels as we wanted and the chairs were very comfortable and clean. Drinks and food at the pool and beach were very good. Nice place to seat after dark if you like the sound of the surf as you have an after dinner cocktail.Beach - 4 stars - there was a lot of seaweed in the water for about 25 feet. The beach was clean but there were a few sand fleas. The hotel provided bug spray. The water was warn and clear once you waded past the seaweed. The restaurant was a nice place to sit after dark if you like the sound of the surf as you have an after dinner cocktail.Hotel staff service - 5 stars. Everyone was attentive and very helpful.Hotel property in general 3.5 stars - public areas clean and well maintained. Rating was impacted down a little due to the quality of the rooms (see below).Hotel rooms 3 stars - adequate (how much do you really stay in the room). Need to be spruced up. Bathrooms adequate but really needs to be updated. Not sure how they can be since they are small and there is no room to expand.Food at the hotel (beach) - 4 stars (again this is at the beach not a 4 star restaurant like the Palm's - need to but everything into perspective).Concierge - 5 stars - all recommendations for dinner were excellent!Overall 4.5 stars!Hope this helps.JAT

<Author>Kamikazetrips
<Content>ICH San Juan shouldn't be part of the ICH group of hotels! Being a Royal Ambassador member and having stayed at nearly a dozen ICH Hotels around the world (Bali, Tokyo, Seoul, Chicago, NYC, Singapore, Bangkok to name a few) I was appalled by the deteriorated physical conditions and lackluster service of the Intercontinental San Juan. I stayed here with my husband from in October of 2006 as part of our anniversary weekend celebration and we were both astonished to see that a hotel of this quality could considered a member of the ICH Group. The place is in DESPERATE need of a face lift. The quality of the room and bathroom finishings are more like those of a 2-star hotel rather than an Intercontinental Hotel. Furniture is worn and beat up and carpets are old and stained. Bathrooms could definitely be gutted! Furthermore, when we visited the pool was still under renovation (after several months of work!). Mini bars are poorly stocked (beverage and food selection was PATHETIC!). More importantly, I was quite underwhelmed by the level of service. Upon check-in I asked the receptionist twice to confirm that I had been properly upgraded to an Executive room or a suite (standard privileges of Royal Ambassador status). She assured me that I had. To my dismay, she had put us in a standard ocean-front room and not in an Executive room or suite. Given that she spoke Native English, I doubt that there was any miscommunication on my part. When I called the General Manager I was put on hold for nearly 30 minutes until I got the right person. I was then informed that I had not been properly upgraded, but that I could move to a junior suite in 20 minutes. We finally moved, but the suite was showed similar signs of deterioration. We never intend to return to this particular ICH hotel and have advised all our friends visiting San Juan not to do so either. If you plan to be on Isla Verde, stay at the Ritz or at the Wyndham instead.  
<Date>Feb 22, 2007

<Author>fp new jersey
<Content>second visit just as good This was our second stay at the San Juan Intercontinental. Both visits were great. The first time, last April our children were with us. This visit, just my husband and I were vacationing. While the rooms are very average, the ocean view(this stay) was much better than the garden view (accepatible). We were on the tenth floor and you definately had a much broader, pretty view. The pool area, recently re-done (tile work) was just as pretty. THe staff works very hard. They are constantly bending over picking up vacationers junk and throwing it away- shame on the tourists- pick up your own garbage. I have to say, there were families there who were definetly there for their own pleasure. They let their children scream by the pool all day. I actually watched 1 family wake up about 10 vacationers sleeping by the pool around 4 pm one afternoon - unacceptable, not because of the hotel but because of parents with no manners. The staff was very good, the concierge great. The front desk and the doormen wonderful. The strip mall across the street has one of the best breakfast places ever - Mi Casita, wonderful food, very reasonable. This visit we ate at a great little, casual (first night) restaurant named Lupi's. Great fajitas, burritos and margaritas at a very reasonable price. Our weather was absolutely perfect which does make a vacation great. I think the Intercontinental (one of the cleanest beaches on Isle Verde) is a great choice. Only complaint was the price of the food!
