<Author>cindas_mommy
<Content>Great Value! My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental in San Juan for a weekend getaway in mid-September. We paid about $120 per night and was impressed with the hotel, staff, and service. The room faced the street and was not very large, but we didn't stay in the room much so it didn't matter. The meal at Ruth's Chris was delicious, the pool was beautiful, and although my French Toast from Room Service was not hot, it was very good. The only problem arose when workmen began repairing something, somewhere, banging on whatever they were fixing, at 7:30am. I called the front desk and the banging stopped with 5 minutes of the call (and five minutes is probably much longer than it really took). I was promptly brought pillows when I requested them and the concierge was very helpful when advising us of activities during our very short stay, including taking into account that I was 6 months pregnant and couldn't participate in certain activities. The hotel was perfect - close to the beach, airport, and a not-so-short bus ride through a rough part of San Juan to Old San Juan. That didn't bother me much - I'm from Chicago - however, others might want to bypass the bus and go with a cab, especially at night. Oh, and I won $100 from a $1.00 bet at the slots in the casino, which featured a non-smoking section that was kept that way by security guards. We will definitely return to the Intercontinental San Juan.  
<Date>Nov 9, 2005

<Author>Cat89
<Content>Nice hotel.... Good value We stayed from 10/26/05 to 10/29/05 at $180/night for cityview room. We inquired about an upgrade to oceanview room, and they were able to accomodate us, which was really appreciated because the hotel faces a busy street. The area in front of the hotel is somewhat rundown. The room was nice, but pretty small. The pool area was nice, water is complimentary where you get the towels. The beach was a little disappointing as their are rundown highrise buildings are in view. However, the water was warm and there were no rocks in the sand. We ate at the metropol one night, food was good and very reasonable. Also, ate at overpriced Ruth's Chris and had mediocor food, and not too much atmosphere. We also ate at the Wyndham El San Juan at the La Piccola Fontana, which was more reasonable than Ruth's Chris and very good. Would also recommend Denny's down the street for breakfast as we paid $45 for breakfast for two one day in the hotel.The Wyndham El San Juan seems to have more nightlife than this hotel and a bigger casino. Overall, I think the resort is a good value especially if you are interested in gambling and nightlife.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Hotel! Beautiful rooms and outstanding pool area, great restaurants, exceptional service provided by a very friendly staff, extremely clean. Lobby is adequate, but small. Casino is small but the staff is very pleasant. Little night life, but you can go next door to the El San Juan. I was quite surprised by this hotel. Good value for the dollar, from rooms to facilities to food  beverages to health club to the beach. Being a frequent traveler to San Juan, and having stayed at all of the major hotels, the Intercontinental is the nicest overall beach front hotel in San Juan. Can't go wrong staying here.

<Author>charlottenchh
<Content>Saved by the Club I travel a lot for my job and needed to get away for a nice quiet vacation with my husband. Booked a quick trip after reading some reviews to the IC in San Juan. When we got there the San Juan area had a huge DC Summit convention arrive that took over most of the hotel Zone. It was a zoo. People everywhere. I was horrified by the all night partying, drug smoking in their rooms, half naked people (in the lobby's) and Sex on the beach (literally not the drink). We had upgraded to an oceanview room which was fantastic but then due to the crowd couldn't sleep so the hotel went out of there way to accomodate us, treated us to a romantic dinner and moved us to the club level due to my loyatly over the years to them. They were really fantastic to us and saved our trip from a nightmare to a memorable trip. My negatvie is San Juan isn't the nicest of areas to visit. A bit dirty and not a lot of extra things to do other than go to Old San Juan.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved IC In Puerto Rico My husband and I just returned from the InterContinental in Isla Verde, Puerto Rico, in the San Juan area 9/18-9/24. This hotel was a wonderful experience and met all my expectations and more. I used the reviews on the tripadvisor website as a guide when I booked this trip and I'm happy I picked this hotel. The hotel was perfect!!!!!!!! The hotel grounds are in excellent condition. The beach on this strip is public, but the hotel security insures nobody from the outside gains access to the IC pool or hotel. It was never to crowded, the food was delicious and the service very friendly...ate in all of them (Ruth Chris, Momoyama (japense rest.), the Italina one (can't remember its name) and ordered food from the pool area. Everything was good. The drinks were also yummy and the swim up bar was a treat. The concierge was pleasant. And they have live entertainment at the bar and the casino. I recommend a room with a view of the city. Ocean view is nice, but San Juan is beautiful at night. Having family from PR I've never experienced the island as a tourist. And staying at the InterContinental was all the worthwhile. I have no complaints about this stay. FYI they also have a gym and Spa onsite. My husband and I highly recommend staying at InterContinental. Especially if your traveling with your honey or the family. A must if you visit PR is El Morro, El Yunque Rainforest, Old San Juan, and Paseo la Princessa - beautiful at night. Who am I kidding there is so much to see a week just wasn't enough.  
<Date>Sep 27, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Lovely hotel...neighborhood so-so The rooms are well kept and neat. Lobby has a nice lounge area with live music in the evenings. The casino is ok...not very large but has most the table games. On a Friday night we were able to get a $10 minimum blackjack table. The pool area is large with an ample supply of cushioned lounge chairs. Although we were there off-season; it may get compeptitive for pool-side seating during peak times. Severs were always visible for poolside drinks or food. You have to wear a bracelet pool-side to show you were a guest and not a mooch, and we were asked several times to show our bracelets (we slipped them off to avoid tan-lines). The extra security was actually kind of nice since the neighboring area was a bit sketchy.The beach is huge, gorgeous, and with flat-sand with plenty of room for many without feeling like you are on top of another group. Hotel guests get lounge chairs and umbrellas (although they did run out of umbrellas later in the day). Water was calm with small waves, very kid-friendly.We never ate dinner in the hotel, but we had lunch at both outdoor cafes (slightly different menus). We noticed that although prices were similar, the pool bar seemed to give larger portions on their meals than the beachfront cafe did (i.e. more fries).One downer - you aren't allowed to bring takeout food to pool area. You can only eat outside food in your rooms or on the beach (beaches are public). Kind of a pain.Like I said, neighboring area is a bit sketchy. There is a supermarket across the street, and some decent takeout choices (if you want to save some $$). We walked to a local place called Lupi's for dinner one night (you hang a left outside the hotel entrance and it's 5-7 minute walk). Good mexican food and drinks..Friday night had karoake, at that point it was full of locals, but the crowd was friendly and cheered for us when we got up to sing (note that margaritas were tasty and STRONG, hence our embarrasing karoake performance). note - there is also a Lupi's in Old San Juan, this one is same owner/chain.We never wandered more than a few blocks in either direction from the hotel, and being an all female group, we never walked alone. We got Pizza Hut one night, Lupi's another and subway for lunch so it's not like we were scared to go out. The area isn't a slum or anything, but it's not exactly the type of neighborhood where you go wandering at night to find a resturant or bars.We ate one night in Old San Juan...had the BEST sangria and cheap Mexican and PR food. I am waiting for credit card bill to verify name and will try to post that. Had an indoor a/c section with front bar (fairly narrow area) and also a larger outdoor but covered patio area. Sangrias served in brown earthenware pitchers and made fresh when ordered! It is close to the square and only 2-3 blocks from the water (the street it is on runs parrallel to the water). Peek at menus and glance in the doors of resturants and you'll find it, has mexican and PR cuisine, and most entrees are under $15 (looking in - the bar is close to the door on the left, tables along the wall to the right and in the rear)...a very casual place. If you are heading towards the square, it's on the left side of the street. Nice portions and great sangria.

<Author>nishnish2000
<Content>AWESOME HOTEL!!! This is a fabulous hotel. My second time in Puerto Rico, stayed at the San Juan Sheraton the first time and hated it there. THe intercontinental had awesome service. We asked to be upgraded but they were unable to do so. The staff was extremely courteous - our luggage was sent upstairs, we didn't have to worry about dragging it to the elevator. The rooms were nice, had a safe, mini fridge, every room has a balcony. A pool view or ocean view room would have been nice, but even the front of the hotel is pretty nice, has a waterfall. Complaints - bathroom is pretty small, shower is really small, i didn't care for it. the bathroom was pretty though and there is a vanity outside the bathroom. Room service wasn't that great, the cleaning lady didn't even bother changing our glasses.This was a very convenient hotel to stay at considering the beach was right outside the hotel and the pool area was just gorgeous. the mediterranean restaurant around the pool area is a bit pricy, the drinks are at least. you are better off buying a drink elsewhere and going to the pool area. Beach is absolutely beautiful, whtie sand, blue skies and clear blue water - what more can you ask for? This hotel is paradise, and i got a great deal on it, perhaps why i wasn't upgraded. The casino and lounge area aren't that great in the hotel. There is a spa though and a salon.  
<Date>Aug 30, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Hotel. Great Location. Great Vacation. I took my wife to San Juan for her 40th birthday(Aug. 12 - Aug.16). Our travel agent recommended the IC  she was absolutely right in saying it was a great hotel. It is only a 5-8 minute taxi ride to the IC from the airport. Upon checking in, we were offered an upgrade from a city view to a beautiful ocean view. Check-in was a breeze and our person (Orlando) checking us in made it very simple for first time visitors to the hotel property. Room was clean  very nice. We ate most of our meals within walking distance from the IC. You can find all of the American food chains within a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Old San Juan is a must for those who visit Puerto Rico(my wife is still raving about the affordable shopping). Even though the casino is smaller than the ones I am used to visiting in Vegas, it is still a lot of fun--the dealers are very nice  personable. One of the best things the IC offered was $5.00 Blackjack with very liberal rules(doubling on any 2 cards, doubling after splitting, etc.)--try finding that in Vegas. For the price we paid on this trip, we came out way ahead(especially if we had stayed at one of the more expensive properties). In conclusion, if you have an upcoming trip to San Juan, I do not think you can go wrong with the IC. I think my wife will always remember the great time she had on her 40th.  
<Date>Aug 20, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>had a wonderful time first i want to thank trip advisor - very informative in all my travel decisions. my family and myself just arrived home from our trip tothe intercontinental in san juan....first of all, the staff is very, very nice and helpful with everything. as a matter of fact they will definitely go out of there way for the quests....i had two adjoining rooms which i requested with a view of the ocean...wonderful. the rooms were very clean and roomy. the pool is spacious with a great swim up bar - restaurant, also thebeach has a bar and restaurant. the hotel staff will carry beach chairs to where ever you want. we ate at ruths chris steakhouse, very nice and pricey. also enjoyed the japanese restaurant, the food was great. we met wonderful people in the lounge, listened to great music and played the slots in the casino...i would recommend the intercontintenal to anyone.

<Author>HIBklyn
<Content>Not a bad hotel... Since I relied on this site heavily when planning my trip to San Juan, I thought I would write a review to help out anyone else. We stayed there from August 10 to August 13. Hotel Room: We had a city view room with a king sized bed on a mid-level floor. The room was okay, the carpet had not been vacuumed - there were sunflower seeds on the floor from the last guest - gross. We had to call to fix the toilet in the bathroom 3 times - it wouldn't stop running all night  then would not flush at all. Unlike other posters here, we did NOT receive the complimentary fruit basket or wine from the hotel after our complaint. You can hear several planes flying by/over since the hotel is close to the airport - this did not bother me, but if you aren't used to it, the noise could keep you awake. Also make sure to check the mini bar when you get into the hotel room - they tried to charge us $3.00 for eating a bag of MM's from the mini-bar that wasn't even there when we checked in!! Otherwise, the maid service was fine after the first day - perhaps because I kept leaving her very good tips.Casino: Nothing like Las Vegas or Atlantic City. Very small with a limited number of machines - many of which were broken or out of service. Thankfully, we are not big gamblers or anything. The casino was virtually empty on Wednesday, but picked up substantially on Thursday and Friday nights. I did not see any waitresses coming around to take drink orders so I don't know if they exist or not. The casino at the El San Juan next door is nicer visually. Pool: The pool was very nice - you are allowed 2 towels at the pool check-in. The Splash! Bar was fun to swim up to  the pina coladas were excellent. A waitress came up to us in the late afternoon to take drink orders also. There were a lot of children playing in the pool throwing balls around, etc. If you don't want to get hit with the ball when you are under the umbrellas, avoid sitting anywhere near the pool. Food: We took the advice of other reviewers  tried the Metropol restaurant down the street - the food was good  reasonable - about $25 for two people for a late lunch. The supermarket across the street was a convenient place to get bottled water  sodas. We also ate at MiCasita for breakfast one morning - it was only $2.50 for the breakfast special of 2 eggs  potatoes  a breakfast meat! There is also a Pizza Hut restaurant down the street that was also good. Like most hotel restaurants, the ones here were WAY overpriced - the Momoyama restaurant was about $25 per person for plain old Chicken Teriyaki - I don't think so!! We ate at the breakfast buffet for $18 each - which was okay, but not the greatest. We also ate at the Palms Restaurant next door in the El San Juan hotel - the service was excellent - our server was Cynthia (she's wonderful) - the food was good and was one of the more reasonably priced hotel restaurants we looked at. Service: The valets are very nice  helpful - we used them to get taxis and directions around the area. We didn't use the concierge or any other services so I can't comment on that. The front desk was great by letting us have a late check out @ 1:00 PM - maybe that was to make up for us having to call about the broken toilet 3 times. Other: When going into Old San Juan, be sure to review the maps  directions that are in the magazines in your hotel room - the had the best directions of all the maps we had  will tell you were to go. It was hotter than the 4th circle of Hell when we were there - we both got heat stroke walking around Old San Juan. Make sure to drink a lot of water. Shopping: Make sure to visit the Coach Factory Outlet  the Ralph Lauren Factory Outlet in Old San Juan on Calle Christo- got some great deals on clothes  a few (early) Christmas presents.All in all, I would stay here again - the price was right, even with a few snafus, it's a nice hotel if you can't afford the Ritz-Carlton. Hope this helps someone else.  
<Date>Aug 15, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Been there 5 times - going back for more i'm new to tripadvisor, so i am posting some reviews of great experiences i've had. We've been to PR and stayed here at least 5 times -- bottom line, there is no better deal in PR than the InterContinental. First, staying in Isla Verde is literally 10 minute cab from the airport -- a huge deal when you are dealing with a quick trip. Second, the rates at the hotel are very reasonable, all classes of rooms. Third, it's right next door -- 2 minute walk -- to one of the best hotel lobbies in Carribeann, the El San Juan (now owned by Wyndham). it is the place to be on the island on weekend nights, with great bars and people watching and a casino i always describe as James Bond-esque. The big deal at the IC is staying in the Club Intercontinental. request a 1st floor room. it is adjacent to the pool system and you get you're own patio and chaise lounges and umbrella, etc. a great place to set up camp by just opening your sliding glass door. and the beach is a short walk from the pool. having easy access to my room is always a big deal for us on beach-type vacations. I can't handle an afternoon frying on the beach/pool. The rooms also have mini-fridges, and we always load up with drinks and snacks at the nearby grocery store when we arrive. Cuts down on that bill.You get a nice room, right next door to the El San Juan for half the price. one last tip -- go to Fortaleza street in Old San Juan for dinner. it's a $15 cab ride, but the old city is beautiful and there are 6 or 7 truly top-notch, non-national chain restaurants to choose from.  
<Date>Aug 8, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fabulous hotel! I just got back this morning from a five day stay at the Intercontinental. I went with two friends for a last-minute weekend getaway, and we had an absolutely wonderful time there. We were upgraded to an ocean view room (all we did was ask for it) and had a gorgeous view of the pool and the ocean. The room was clean and had all the amenities that we needed. The pool was extremely refreshing, and the beach was private and clean with clear water and good security. My friends and I keep kosher, which means that we had to bring our food and couldn't eat at the restaurants, so I can't comment on that. The casino was small but fun, if you want a larger casino and/or a nightclub you can go next door to the Wyndham. We went to the Wyndham one night but enjoyed ourselves more at the casino in the Intercontinental. Having visited (but not stayed at) the Wyndham, I am extremely relieved that we went with the Intercontinental. The Wyndham feels more like a casino than a hotel, and the Intercontinental has too many qualities to stay anywhere else. The staff in general was wonderful - they were extremely nice, helpful, and cheerful. Nestor the concierge was terrific, he took care of everything we needed. All in all, we had a fabulous experience and would go back in a heartbeat. I have told all my friends that the Intercontinental is the way to go!  
<Date>Jul 11, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great place for the money We just came back from Puerto Rico (June 27th), we stayed at the Intercontinental the day prior to leaving for a cruise and for one day after returning from the cruise. My husband and I are beach goers, but this hotel actually had us sunning by the pool. Service: The service by the pool was fantastic. Friendly staff and available each time we wanted to order.Pool: Pool was smaller than others we have seen in Mexico, but still very refreshing. The swim up bar provided a little shade and great service and drinks. Dancing and music provided great entertainment by the pool; however, the music was a bit loud, but did not play continuously. There were plenty of sunning chairs and shaded chairs by the pool absolutely no problem finding a chairBeach: The beaches in Puerto Rico are open to the public so it was a bit different than being in Mexico - pretty crowded on the second night. Still beautiful and clean. No huts to sit under like in Mexico, and chairs must be rented. I prefer some shade while my husband likes full sun so we stuck with the pool except for short swims in the ocean and a stroll. Bathrooms by the beach were clean. Room: The room was available for checkin early. Very clean. We had to have a safe installed the first day, and the wireless keyboard was jacked so we checked out at the desk. I'm pretty picky when it comes to the room and I felt it was nice and clean.Casino: My husband is the gambler and he said the casino was just ok. If I'm not mistaken it is collared shirts and slacks while gambling in the evening.Food: We did not dine at the hotel, there is a Ruth Chris steakhouse and a Japanese grill. I believe there is also an Italian restraunt. We were trying to conserve after being on the cruise, so we crossed the street to Subway where there is also KFC, Wendy's, Taco bell. We walked down the street one night and had dinner on the patio of a Mexican restraunt/bar. The food there was fantastic. We paid 170 each night, but I believe for the money we stayed at one of the nicer hotels there without exceeding $200 dollars. We would definitely stay there again.  
<Date>Jun 30, 2005

<Author>dsnarl
<Content>One of the better Isla Verde Resorts. We have stayed at the Intercontiental several 3 times over 3 different winters. Despite the Hotel being full almost every time we stayed there, it never felt uncomfortable. The rooms were always well furnished and cleaner than the average carribean hotel. Last time we stayed on the club area, which is a separate building on the right side of the pool. The club level was nice, but the club level is not catered towards travellers with children. The pool area is very nice, although I really wish they'd heat the pool. We've eaten at Momoyama (Japanese) which was good, Ruth's Chris which was surprisingly a hit with my 7 year old - (Very good meal). La Terraza and Ciao Mediteranean were good standbys. However, there are dozens of decent restaruants all within walking distance of this hotel.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A Solid Place to Stay My girlfriend and I traveled down to San Juan for Memorial Day weekend. Most everything you have read in previous reviews is true of the Intercontinental. Good pool, friendly service, and well maintained. I found the casino to be everything someone on a beach vacation would want. Yes it's small, but not cramped, and never too crowded. They have every casino game you would want/expect, plus four Texas Hold'em tables. But really, who's traveling down there to gamble? If you really feel the itch, the El San Juan does have a more serious casino. We were lucky enough to get upgraded upon arrival to a club level suite. Our room was wonderful. Clean, spacious, and with a view of the pool. The pool area had a very nice atmosphere that seemed to have a little of everything. You could lounge all day in a quiet spot, you could drink at the swim up bar and listen to the top 40 music, or you could join the younger crowd flirting in the pool. The beach is nice, but it seemed to become less pleasant as you strayed farther from the IC. If you have planned a stay at the IC, you have nothing to worry about. We found it to be clean, fun, and relaxing. Hope you enjoy yourselfs as much as we did.  
<Date>Jun 4, 2005

<Author>Indian91
<Content>Generally positive Nearly everything was very good at the Intercontinental. The pool is great, the staff is universally friendly and attentive and the overall property is well-maintained and clean. The casino is OK, but the ESJ casino next door is much better - better blackjack dealers, better drink service. My only complaint is that the place turned into a frat house on the weekends. Many rooms near us were filled with loud, drunk college kids. Fortunately, hotel security was responsive and quieted them on the multiple occasions that we complained about the noise.

<Author>Cdix
<Content>A class act in San Juan After learning that the rooms in the Wyndham El San Juan were in the beginning stages of a badly-needed upgrade, (and after a scary experience at the Wyndhan Aruba), we booked a King, ocean-view superior (high floor) room at the Intercontinental. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a room in the Intercontinental Club suite -- close to the pool, free breakfast and happy hour with snacks and the club concierge. The room was large and extremely clean and pleasant, the bed was comfortable and the marble bathroom was a decent size. I agree with some of the other posts about the service in this hotel -- it was amazing. The casino was small and not worth spending much time in. The pool was beautiful, better than what I saw at the Wyndham; beach was nice as well. The beach was not as nice as Luquillo, but for Isa Verde, it was fine. The hotel seems to cater to business travelers, not too many children and not a big bar scene--both of which were fine for us. We went to Old San Juan and the Wynhdam next door at night. It was more of a nice, classy hotel rather than a beach resort. Overall, despite some rain, it was a great trip. I would stay there again if I chose Isla Verde.Happy Travels!  
<Date>May 18, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Very nice hotel and staff, on the beach We stayed at the Intercontinental May 13-15 for a weekend get-away. The staff are very nice, helpful, and really seem happy that you're there, genuinely polite. Hotel and the rooms are beautiful with a great view of either the city or the beach. The casino was nice. Very polite security personnel throughout the hotel and grounds. Taxis were readily available and resonably priced. However, we were disappointed with a couple of things. We didn't know that May is apparently the rainy season and it rained every day, and the Weather Channel predicted rain every day for the following week. Also, we were promised white sand and good snorkeling right off the beach. Nuh-uh. The sand was nice and soft, but the regular golden color, and you couldn't see anything while snorkeling. Not sure if this was because of there being so much rain lately, or if the waves kept everything churned up and murky. Also, the bathroom door was broken and didn't shut very easily, but we didn't complain about it (I just hope they don't think we broke it and charge our credit card!) The restaurants in the hotel are pricey, but there are plenty of fast food restaurants across the street from the hotel, plus a good restaurant with affordable local cuisine just down the street called the Metropol. Mainly because of the staff, we'd return to the Intercontinental.  
<Date>May 16, 2005

<Author>lodes
<Content>Great Place! Rooms:My husband and I stayed here with friends in April and had a great time.Our room was immaculate and the bathroom fresh and clean. We had a beautiful ocean view with a small balcony. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. Service:The most striking thing about this hotel is the service. Everyone from housekeeping to management greets you with a smile. Nestor the concierge was wonderful. He even promised it would stop raining and it did! Beach:There was a huge storm hanging over the island when we arrived. Fortunately it blew out the next day. The storm did, however, churn up the water making it very murky and depositing a lot of seaweed on the beach. The IC was the ONLY hotel on the strip that had the beach raked clean the next day! The ocean was warm and calm. My only compaint for the entire stay is that there is a $10 charge for beach umbrellas that are not even in great shape. It seems at this level of hotel the umbrellas should be provided without an additional charge. Pool:After the storms the water was quite cool but did warm up in the next day or so. The pool is large and beautiful. There were plenty of chairs available even though the hotel was sold out. The pool service was outstanding and the pool bar was very good but a bit pricey ($9 per typical drink). Nightlife:They have a very nice, intimate lobby bar with a singer on most nights. A great place to start or end your evening. The guys liked the casino but none of us are big time gamblers. It was a bit too bright and cold for me. Definately the best place to be at night is next door at the Wyndham. Lots of local atmosphere and enertainment. Also check out the Waterclub down the street. The rooftop bar has a beautiful night view of Isla Verde. Its open air with a trendy atmosphere. The elevator ride alone is worth the 2 block walk. Food:The breakfast buffet at the IC is phenomenal. All the usual plus homemade waffles, bagels and lox, cheese blintzes and more. We purchased the breakfast built into our room rate which was the best way to go. We had lunch twice at the Ciao Mediterranean restaurant that is directly between the beach and pool area. Great place to enjoy the beach view and have lunch. La Piccola Fontana at the Wyndham was our best dinner there. Fine Northern Italian cuisine with excellent service. We also loved Dragonfly in Old San Juan. This is not for everyone though. Very dark atmosphere and funky menu. All dishes are served for the whole table and shared. My favorite was the Peking Duck Nachos. Overall we had a great experience and I would return to the InterContinetal again. San Juan is not a remote tropical get-away but a great place for having fun with lots of nightlife and activities. If you are reading this because you are planning a trip I am very jealous!  
<Date>May 9, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Awesome Vacation First I want to make clear that this trip consisted of 8 girls aged 21-23. We were looking for sun, pretty beach, a nice pool scene and a good party!Weather was beautiful. Although its hot, its not US hot. There is a cool breeze from the ocean which makes the heat bearable.Beach was okay. I am from Jersey which means just about any beach is better than ours, but it wasn't fabulous. Noisy but good for laying out with friends.Pool at the IC was nice. We had no problem finding beach chairs at any time of the day. It was always clean. There was a swim up bar, but we never used it. The hot tub was nice, but can get a little to hot!!Party scene was awesome. We were right next door to Babylon in the El San Jaun Wyndham. Although we tried other places, we always ended up finishing off our nigths at the Babylon. NYC type club, but a far different crowd. Full of PR locals and well as tourist. We went to Senor Frogs one night too, it was an okay time, but on the empty side..The IC also has a little gym. By little, I mean very little! 3 treadmills and some weight machines. I went there about everyday, but only got to use the treadmill onces. It over looks the ocean, which is breathtaking, but only if you get a treadmill!Food was okay. We went to the mexican restuartant in the El San Juan Wyndham one night. It was good food at a reasonable cost. Other nights we just did the typical college diet which includes Burger king (which is across the street), Taco Bell, Pizza Hut etc. All within walking distance.We went to the rainforest as well. It is beautiful but not recommended after a night of extensive partying. The trip leaves pretty early and there is a lot of walking to do in the rainforest. Bacardi factory was a waste of time. Tour is very boring. Like going to a museum in 2nd grade. $6 for a bottle of Bacaradi there, but its $4 at the airport. Safe yourself the hassle. The rooms were good. Clean and served the purpose. Although the last night, our hallway carpeting was soaking wet. No idea why, but our rooms where fine. Best part of the room was that there was a fully lighted mirror outside the bathroom as well as inside. ( I know all you girls understand the need for that!)All in all, it was a great trip. Language barrier was not a problem. Most ppl speak english and our spanish wasn't bad. Counting the days to go back..  
<Date>May 2, 2005

<Author>mama0f2
<Content>Average hotel My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental April 26th-30th. I will start by listing the positives.-Very close to the airport. About a 5 minute taxi ride.-In walking distance to other places to eat if you don't want to spend $50 a meal at the hotel everytime just for breakfast. (Burger King, Grocery Store, MI Casita Restaurant which is very good for breakfast about $15 for 2 of us to eat.)-Beautiful beach. White powder sand. No rocks, or shells. Water was blue-green color and absolutely gorgeous. Very, very warm this time of year. The best part of the whole trip.-Excellent Italian restaurant in hotel. Expensive but probably the best meal we have had in a long time.Now the negatives.-Rooms are not what I expected. Carpet gross ( had to wear sandals at all times in the room. The overall apperance of the room needs updating. Probably the main reason I would not return to this hotel. There has to be better out there for your money. My husband and I are really picky but this needs improvement.-Bathrooms are also pretty gross. Shower has no water pressure. Fixtures in bathroom are all rusted and look terrible. -Casino is ok. But try the Wyndham El San Juan next door. There's is 10 times better and not nearly as smoky because it's much bigger.All in all this hotel was ok because of it's location. (10 min. $16 cab ride each way to Old San Juan. Does get expensive though) And, because of it's wonderful beach and pool area. If I was going to travel again to Puerto Rico I would stay at the Wyndham next door. MUCH nicer hotel. It's breath taking inside. The woodwork/ moldings are beautiful. MUCH more upper class than the Intercontinenal.Other San Juan tips: Don't go to Condado. What a dump. Nothing to see and under complete construction everywhere.And, skip the bacardi rum factory tour. What a waste of a day. Takes a few hours with travel time. Rum is cheaper there. But I would spend the extra money and enjoy the beach more and skip this one. Hope this helps!!  
<Date>May 1, 2005

<Author>paulap70
<Content>A Great Property! My husband and I stayed at the IC for one night preceeding and two nights following a cruise. The hotel is absolutely fantastic! We were able to upgrade to ocean view from city view rooms for a $40 upcharge each night. We definitely wanted to have the ocean view! We ate dinner one night at Metropol as we have on previous trips. The restaurant isn't much for atmosphere, but the food is good and inexpensive. Another night, we ate at Ruth's Chris Steakhouse, located on hotel grounds. Excellent food! Our waiter, Alejandro, was great and gave us some excellent site-seeing tips! A traveler's tip: don't consume the items in the hotel mini-bar. It's very easy to simply walk across the street to the Isla Verde Fresh Food market and get all of the pop, beer, water, and snacks you could want. For example, hotel mini-bar charges $5 for a can of Medalla Light beer. A six-pack is $5.99 at the store! There's also a Walgreen's a few blocks to the west, in case you need a necessity or simply want photos developed. San Juan is a great place to vacation and the IC is excellent. If you're going on a Royal Caribbean cruise departing San Juan, go over to the Pan American terminal around noon (the cruise line will tell you boarding begins at 4 PM for 10 PM sail). You'll get right on and be able to enjoy the ship earlier!  
<Date>Apr 26, 2005

<Content>Fabulous Time Husband, daughter  I arrived on April 6th for 4nites. Fabulous hotel, Concierge terrific. Room  bath always very clean; room service prompt. <Author>Chardo
<Content>Long review of short stay Wife and I (the kids stayed home) stayed for long weekend 3/31 to 4/3. Overall, everything was excellent.BOOKING: Used AAVacations, as we have done before. Best prices, very easy to use, no surprises. Well, one surprise which I'll get to later.ARRIVAL: Quick luggage retrieval at SJU. No customs at all, just walked out of the airport. I know PR is a US territory, but I still expected some sort of customs check. We were told to bring proof of citizenship, but we never needed it. Outside the terminal was a taxi stand with one person ahead of us. About 2 minute wait for taxi, followed by 5 minute ride to hotel ($8 plus .50 per suitcase). Can't get any easier.CHECK-IN: We reserved a super saver room. When I know a hotel will not be crowded (off season, week after holiday, etc.), I usually book the cheapest room upfront and then haggle for an upgrade at the desk. Our desk clerk started his pitch for us to join Intercontinental's rewards program. For $150, we would get an upgrade during this and all other stays at IC hotels for one year, plus other perks. We really didn't need the perks, and we don't plan on staying at any other IC hotels this year, so I wasn't too excited about the deal. The desk clerk then took us on a special tour. He wanted to show us the room we booked and the upgraded room. The booked room turned out to be a 7th floor junior suite overlooking the city. Very nice room, but the view was not exactly tropical. Then he showed us the upgraded room. It was 12 floor overlooking the pool and ocean. Great view, but the room (non-suite) was actually smaller than the other. I figured we don't spend much time in the room, so the ocean view would be nicer. But, I didn't want to pay $150 for it. We went back down to the front desk. I told him I like the ocean room better, but I'll pass on the deal. Unless he could give me the ocean room anyway....which is exactly what he did. Like I said, you can usually schmooze a free upgrade if the hotel isn't crowded. Anyway, I gave him a nice tip just in case he lost out on some commission by not selling me the plan. Other than setting us back some time for this tour, it was a pleasant check-in. He even said that our reservation includes breakfast every day, which was news to me. My reservation documents specifically said no meals. I figured we're gonna eat anyway, so I'll either get a bill at checkout or a nice surprise.ROOMS: I didn't pay very close attention to the city-view junior suite (considered their standard room), but it was large and very nice. Our oceanview room was smaller, though not too small by any means. King bed, sitting area, very small balcony (chair can only fit sideways). Bathroom a little small (crowded with two people), but nicely appointed. Overall luxury on par with Hyatt, Marriott, etc.POOL: A primary reason for staying here. Beautiful lagoon freeform pool with waterfall, surrounded by lots of palm trees. Very clean, nice temp, not crowded. Plenty of lounge chairs.BEACH: Clean, soft sand. Very large beach, so it never seems crowded. Waves churn up the sand at the shoreline, so the water gets murky. Looks great from the room, though. Very short walk to vendors for jetski, parasail, and banana boat. Hotel employees place your lounge chair where you want, and waiters take drink and food orders right on the beach (and at the pool).CASINO: Disappointing to me, but I guess that's the impression you get when you lose. Small compared to most US casinos, but not uncomfortable. For comparison, bigger than Caribe Hilton, but smaller than El San Juan. Most of the island casinos have just one craps table and a few blackjack tables in use. This craps table had a drain at the bottom that just sucked my chips in all the time. We actually did much better (and therefore enjoyed) the casino at Ritz Carlton. Not impressed with El San Juan's casino (next door to IC), though the rest of that hotel is special.NIGHTLIFE: None to speak of, besides casino. There's a lobby bar with a singer at night, but usually a small crowd gathered there. El San Juan next door has much more activity.DINING: Breakfast buffet every day is very good. Not only do they make omelets to order (like most good buffets), but they also make the french toast and waffles right there. Takes a little longer, but much better than mass-cooked french toast sitting in a chafing dish. Breakfast is $18.95. Big price, but in line with other resorts. Also, we ate so much that we didn't want lunch. Add it up and it's not a bad deal. If cost is a concern, there are several options across the street for desayuno, including almost every American fast food chain. We did not eat at any other restaurants at this hotel. Our first night, we went to La Casona. It was our anniversary, so we wanted upscale. Very fancy restaurant about 10 minute ride away from hotel. We had been there before and it was worth the repeat visit. Very expensive. Dinner for 2 with a moderate bottle of wine was over $150. Their wine list is very impressive, and can easily add hundreds to the tab if you want to really splurge. Second night we went to Metropol, which is about a half mile walk from the hotel. Place had all the atmosphere of a local coffee shop, but excellent food. Even with a pitcher of (very good) sangria, check was about $60. Best bargain of the trip--I highly recommend going. Third night we ate at Mi Casita, which is directly across the street from IC. Similar to Metropol (good food, no atmosphere, similar prices), though they serve mainly Puerto Rican food as opposed to Metropol's Cuban food. Honestly, the two cuisines are about as different as Chinese and Japanese. Kinda different yet similar. I recommend both restaurants.CHECKOUT: Always the saddest part of the trip, but here was the surprise. My extras bill totalled $18. Just tips at breakfast and a drink by the pool. No charge for breakfast. AAVacations was wrong, I guess.AIRPORT: Be aware that the American Airlines terminal has almost nothing to eat. Not even a Starbucks or Dunkin, which are usually all over the place. We had to wait 40 minutes at some concession stand for instant coffee at about $2 a cup. I'm not making this up. Make sure you have your coffee and breakfast before you head to the airport.Let me know if you have any questions--rich(at)rannigilbert.com  
<Date>Apr 11, 2005

<Author>dreamvac
<Content>Outstanding resort! One of our best vacations! My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed this resort from the moment the bellman greeted us at the door. The staff was very warm and truly working towards our enjoying our stay. Check in was an ease and they graciously upgraded our room to an oceanfront room. Our bags were promptly brought up for us. The hotel is lobby is beautiful, but the true gem is the gorgeous pool area and beach. The property was so enjoyable, we did not want to leave it! We went into Old San Juan only one day of the 5 nights we stayed and just enjoyed the warm pool, vigorous jacuzzi, relaxing beach, excellent drinks and food by the pool and pool cafe... The pool bar staff were very attentive and made outstanding drinks. There is a spa where I endulged in a 80 minute deep tissue massage that was perfect. There are excellent inexpensive restaurants in walking distance--Luipis a sports bar, mexican grill and Metropole a cuban, puerto rican restauran. One night we ate at the restauarant near the La Playa Hotel that is right on the water that specializes in seafood and ribs and has a breathtaking view of San Juan at night. I will return to Puerto Rico and the Intercontinental.  
<Date>Apr 10, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>First and last visit The beach left much to be desired: the sand was dirty and because of the way the beach is laid out, it's not conducive to small children.The room was worth about half the price we paid. Chipping paint in the room and a bathroom not in the greatest shape (old grout in the shower, stopped up tub drain) made for a huge question mark about the price.Service/staff was pleasant enough and the location is ideal in that it's so close to the airport and Old San Juan tourist areas.The pool was nice and great for kids. They put out a lot of floaties and toys for them to play with, but what a bummer that for the duration of our stay the bar that's inside the pool never opened.We made reservations one night at Ruth's Chris. Let me just say that it seemed like there was NO WAY that restaurant part of the same chain. We eat at Ruth's Chris quite a bit back home and those were NOT the same caliber steak. I wondered whether I was actually eating beef, as did the other 3 people in my group...A disappointment, yes, but a lesson learned for next time.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The Perfect Winter Getaway... The Intercontinental Hotel is located right next door to the El San Juan Hotel in Puerto Rico but why leave ? This hotel has all the amenities; beautiful grounds with winding pool, hot jacuzzi that fits 30 people, salon, 2 poolside restaurants- one overlooks the beach and ocean with gentle breezes and ultra friendly service. The food is good; salads with chicken, cubano and club sandwiches, etc. You can order from your comfortable lounge chair by the pool or on the beach without missing a beat. I recommend the Club Level rooms which are a little more expensive, but so worth the location; 10 steps from the pool/beach/food. No elevators or long hallways, open the sliders and you've arrived. The bed is comfortable, a small couch and desk ($10 internet access via ether cable) are just inside the glass doors. The Club Level also includes a club lounge mainly for business travelers that is set up 3 times a day with an abundane of on the go type meals and drinks. (bagels, fruit, coffee, cheese/crackers, wine, liquor, etc.) Access the beach through tall iron gates which are locked at 6pm promptly every night. (Try to be inside the gates after dark, wristband required for re-entry) The pool water was a little chilly so we venterd into the warm ocean one day. The waves were a little rough being on the Atlantic side of the island, but it's glorious when the east coast of US is in a deep freeze. Ruth Chris steakhouse is on the property, outstanding, need I say more. There are two other restaurants and a small casino on the property, just enough of a variety without being crowded. Room service is 24 hrs.One night we went nex door to the El San Juan, it was nice to see the beautiful lobby, but unless you're a serious gambler, don't bother. For a quick getaway full of sun and relaxation, Intercontinental is the place to go.  
<Date>Mar 17, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great location, beautiful pool and beach This is going to be quick and dirty -- Beach is awesome, great site seeing and people watching. Water is fantastic. Did not get hassled on the beach from vendors which is unusual for the Carribbean.Pool facilities are great -- plenty of pool for all guests. The pool bar was closed during my stay, but it looks like it will be great when it opens up again. Casino -- the worst I've ever been to. BUT, you are right next door to one of the nicer ones in the Carribean at the El San Juan.Hotel Rooms - fine - better than I expected. Little CD player in room - bring CDs. Hotel Dining is great -- the breakfast buffet fit the bill, the menu and food at the Ciao Medditereneo are not to be missed - look to get tables overlooking the beach. Check in can be slow, so US travellers be prepared to wait. The staff is courteous (not so much with the Casino staff / Casino wait staff). If someone dumped $1MM into this hotel it could stand alongside the El San Juan as a premier location. I'd put all of the money into the lobby / Casino - dump the Casino staff and start fresh. The Intercontinental has an amazing location alongside the nicest hotels in SJ, they should do a better job taking advantage of the opportunity. Truly, this hotel's promixity to the PR gem, the Wyndam El San Juan is why you would want to stay here. ESJ has great nightlife from salsa dancing to a very nice casino and amazing bar, you really can't go wrong at the ESJ any night of the week.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A GREAT GREAT HOTEL My fiance and I just returned from the Inter-Continental a couple of days ago. We stayed from March 9-13 and had a WONDERFUL time. As a matter of fact, I went through a minor depression period before we had to leave :) From the moment we got there to the moment we left, we were treated wonderfully by the entire staff. We originally had a street view room and when we got there we asked to be upgrated to oceanview. They were happy to accomodate us with a beautiful and large oceanview room. The balcony is a bit small, but it was not a big deal in the slightest. The rooms are a bit musty and feel wet, but that did not stop us from enjoying every other aspect of the gorgeous hotel. The pool area is absolutely beautiful with palm treas, waterfalls, and very clean water. We had so many things planned to do during our stay and did not end up doing any of it because we were so happy, pleased, and had such a great time just hanging out on the grounds of the beautiful hotel. The wrist bands (which everyone complains about) are not troublesome in any way. The food on the grounds is very good. We live in NYC and are used to eating out a lot, and even to us the food was exceptional. You must try Passagio, which is located in the hotel because it's wonderful. We had dinner there 2 times but do not get the Chef's Sampler dessert because it's way too small a portion for $10. Ciao's Medditaranean Cafe (located by the pool area) is a wonderful and convinient place to grab lunch. Also, the Splash swim-up bar is awesome. Don't forget to try the Mojito's and the frozen Rum Runners (prepared by Danny the bartender) they are awesome!! We went right before spring break and it was not crowded at all, so make sure when you book your stay it is not during times when it's crowded because that can ruin the experience. El San Juan is literally right next door and also has some wonderful restaurants. Try La Picolla Fontana if you're looking for great Italian.I highly recomend this hotel to everyone. We had a wonderful experience and would return any time!!!  
<Date>Mar 15, 2005

<Author>annabelle32

<Content>Beautiful and relaxing My wife and I stayed for four nights at the InterContinental after a cruise we took on Royal Caribbean. The hotel is 15-20 minutes by taxi from Old San Juan and 10 minutes from the airport. The beach was clean and they had complimentary beach chairs and umbrellas. The pool area was amazing. <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Very nice hotel Just came back from a wonderful vacation at the InterContinential Resort  Casino. My stay was from 3/3 to 3/7  everyday I had a great time. From the minute my friends  I walked into the hotel the staff was very friendly  helpful. The concierge, Nestor, was a great help by recommending restaurants  making reservations for us. There is a Ruth Chris steak house in the resort that you definitely must go to for dinner. Another fantastic restaurant which is only about 8 blocks from the hotel is La Fontana  is located on the top floor of the Howard Johnsons. They have excellent Italian food! Coming from a very Italian neighbor hood in New York I was very impressed. You feel as if you were eatting in a Little Italy Manhattan restaurant. The pool area is very nice with small waterfalls coming into the pool area. The beach is very clean  relaxing. There are workers who will get you chairs  set you up anywhere you would like to sit. Everytime you come in  out of the hotel someone is there to open the door for you. The only one negative about the hotel is the breakfast prices. $18.95 a person for a buffet breakfast is a little expensive to me so it is not something you would want to do every morning. Other then that, you will have a wonderful time!  
<Date>Mar 8, 2005

<Author>wise2374
<Content>Nice enough resort Wife and I stayed here only one night after our flight to NYC was cancelled.Hotel's best feature is its lobby area, which is sharp and attractive. There's a nice lobby bar and an active and lively casino right off of the lobby. The hotel's beach - being on Isla Verde - is very nice for the San Juan area, although generally not as nice as non-San Juan areas or other more secluded Caribbean areas. The pool area has plenty of chairs but feels a little cramped - slightly more reminiscent of the community pool than a pool at a beach resort. The rooms were niced sized and had a decent small balcony but surprisingly musty/mildew-y - additionally, our TV remote didn't work.The location is nicer for the beach than the Condado or Old San Juan areas, as there's less activity in general in the area. However, that also means that there are more nightlife and restaurant options closer to both Condado and Old San Juan than here. Between the nearby Wyndham, Water Club and this hotel, there are a number of good restaurants and bars to be had, but they're mostly chic clubby-types (Tangerine at Water Club) or high end steakhouses (Ruth's Chris and I believe the Palm at IC and Wyndham). There aren't as many good local options - unless you're willing to pay the $12 to cab it to those other areas, which frankly isn't a big deal. So, on the Condado/Old San Juan vs. Isla Verde question, it depends what you're looking for. Quieter and marginally nicer beach? Isla Verde. More activity with a more bustling beach? Condado/Old San Juan.Overall, the next time I'm in Puerto Rico, I'm unlikely to stay here. I'd either choose a true beach resort (such as the Westin Rio Mar, which is very nice but a 40-min ride from San Juan) or a Condado resort with a good enough beach, but a little closer to the other restaurants  activities.  
<Date>Mar 7, 2005

<Author>mapmaster23
<Content>Intercontinental Divide When is (near) perfection so uninspired?... when one visits The Intercontinental. By typical hotel evaluation parameters, I'd be hard-pressed to state a negative word....every hotel employee was unfailingly friendly and sought to be helpful. The pool area was visually appealing and large enough to accommodate a sold-out hotel. The room was clean, well appointed, and comfortable. The only possible complaints (and minor, to be sure) were the vest-pocket sized casino, and the ineffectiveness of a seemingly well intentioned concierge ...I would be advised that a particular restaurant was unavailable, and then be offered his recommendationas an alternative, only to find that the establishment that I wished to dine at was indeed available...hmmm. What the hotel lacks is a specific personality, any sort of distinctiveness. By comparison, the lobby of the El San Juan on Friday evening fullfilled my fantasies of 1957 Havana, with lusty Latin music playing, and happy dancers crowding the dance floor. The Ritz Carlton announces your arrival with the smell of flowers even before you've finished your turn in their revolving door..The Intercontinental?...It's the Admiral's Club Lounge at the airport...clean, quiet, comfortable, functional in every possible way....yet unceasingly bland.Staying at The Intercontinental is similar to going to a premium ice cream parlor, and ordering vanilla. It may just be the finest vanilla ice cream in the world, but it is unmistakingly vanilla. For some, this will be more than sufficient, for others, not at all.  
<Date>Feb 27, 2005

<Author>MikeNCal
<Content>Very Nice Hotel The Inter-Continental San Juan is a very nice hotel on a great beach. My experience was very nice. I was upgraded to a Gold level room upon arrival. Room was large and very clean. Opened right onto the pool area. Gold level included breakfast and evening cocktail hour. This hotel is much more relaxed than the Marriott with it's booming music in the pool area. IC hotel also had more chairs available in the pool area. Security is also very good and staff are pleasant.The only draw back to this hotel is that it is in Isle Verde. The beach is great there, but Condado and Old San Juan is where the evening action is. Once the Renaissance and Vanderbilt open in Condado, Isle Verde will be dead. So the IC is a great hotel, but plan on taking a taxi or bus in the evening unless you like hotel and chain restaurants.  
<Date>Feb 24, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Unbelievable staff My wife and I just returned from 4 days at the Intercontinental San Juan from 1/7 - 1/10/05. As much as I travel on business, I can tell you that I've never stayed anywhere that offered the level of personal service that we received here. We did not stay in the 'tower', but instead upgraded to one of the suites next to the pool. We literally walked out of our room and into the tropical pool area. The first night we dined at Ruth's Chris, which, if you've ever eaten there in other cities, you know that they make the greatest steaks around. We were not disappointed. On Saturday, my wife demanded that I go play golf somewhere while she laid by the pool and did absolutely nothing. Unfortunately for both of us, it rained on and off that entire day but it was still very relaxing for her, and I got to play a nice course (Rio Mar at the Westin Resort). That night we ate at Passagio's, their Italian restaurant on site. We were not that impressed, as our waiter was nowhere to be found most of the time, and spoke unintelligible English. On Sunday, with weather forecasts for skattered showers, we rented a car (through the concierge) and drove up Rt 187 which runs along the ocean. Very nice drive and you can even drive right up onto the beach and park for awhile. Sunday night we ate at Fontana De Roma, an Italian restaurant on top of the Howard Johnson's Hotel, about 8 blocks form the Intercontinental. Very nice place, 10th floor over looking everything, and the food was Excellent and the quantities were huge. Loved it. Sure enough, on Monday the sun came out without a cloud in the sky but we had some shopping to do for the kids so we couldn't really enjoy the great weather. Arrive at least 90-minutes before your flight because of their unusual way of checking bags. Not a big deal; just takes a long time.If you have the opportunity to work with Rosie at the Concierge, consider yourself fortunate. She is AWESOME. There's nothing she can't do for you. Also, look for Jose Rivera out front for taxi's and other advice...great guy. All in all, a wonderful stay and we will definitely be returning.  
<Date>Jan 14, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Too Many Cruise Ship Guests Nice hotel. Refrigerator so you can shop across the street and eat breakfast and lunch in your room. Too many cruise ships use this hotel as a shore tour. Hotel guests have to reserve their pool chaises early or you will not get one.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Nice Hotel-Great and Friendly Service My family recently returned from a 7-day stay at the Intercontinental over the holidays. Initally, a little apprehensive about the trip as we had never visited Puerto Rico. We were pleasantly surprised as the Intercontinental staff are very attentive and friendly. Initially, our room was not ready so we could not check in until 4:00 p.m. This gave us an opportunity to explore our surroundings. Rooms are small but clean. There were 3 of us (2 adults and 1 8-year old). They recommended a room with double beds which we later found out it would have been better to request a king size bed as those rooms come with a sleeper sofa. We stayed in an ocean view room which was nice, however, the mini suites are much nicer and do not cost that much more (we asked to see the mini and executive suites). We dined at Ruth Chris' and also had the breakfast buffet. Ruth Chris was excellent and the buffet was just ok-not worth a repeat. Pool area is very clean and was not crowded. Beach is nice, however, waves have lots of sand and water is very cloudy. We were told it was due to the time of year. Casino is small, however, we felt it was just enough and the staff in the casino were again friendly. All in all, we intend to return as the pace is slow, hotel is clean and people extremely friendly.  
<Date>Jan 3, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>exceeded expectations We took our 3 children, 2 girls 17 and a 15 year old son for a week to the Intercontinental. We basically chose this hotel because the rates were more reasonable than the El San Juan and Ritz. We booked late and still caught a special where we got our second room at half price. We were extremely nervous about the property because the reviews on this web site were not encouraging. When we arrived, we were pleasantly suprised. The rooms were fine, clean, served the purpose. One night, the air conditioning made some noise. The Hotel staff was fixed the problem and then left a fruit basket in the room, for our troubles. The staff was extremley pleasant and accomodating. The food at the pool was o.k. and service a bit slow but it was very crowded, being Christmas week. Overall, I would not be afraid to book this hotel. The Ritz facility was much nicer but we were paying $200 a night less. The El San Juan was too much of a scene, but the kids liked to go at night. All in all , it was a great trip.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Perfect Vacation We stayed at the IC over the holidays because of the location, pool, and amenities. We were a bit nervous since there were some bad reviews about service. We only experienced great service. When we had one problem (very late room service) they not only gave us the room service for free but also gave us free lunch. The staff is very friendly and attentive. The rooms are attractive and clean. The view, beach, pool and bars are great. The food is what you would expect from a resort hotel. If you're a foodie go into old san juan for dinner. We thought the casino was nice because it was small and peaceful. This is a perfect hotel for just relaxing at the beach and pool yet conveniently located for taking a taxi into a town or a car to the rain forest.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Hotel My family and I just returned from our six day Christmas trip in San Juan. We were nervous about the hotel, but very pleased. It is old, but has been redone in the last few years. It has local flavor which we liked. We found the hotel simple, yet very comfortable. The staff was very pleasant and always helpful. You are very near the airport and can hear the planes, but this did not bother us. A safe and mini fridge are in all rooms.We loved being close to a grocery and pharmacy for American basics. We walked all over and rented a car for a couple of days for fishing, diving and the rain forest. They were all incredible. The original walled Old San Juan and it's forts were amazing. Be patient the traffic to and from this tight area is heavy all the time. The cruise ships come in this area at times it becomes congested.The beach and pool area at the IC were perfect. The beach chairs and towels are free and they charge for umbrellas. We took our three children that are in college and they loved it. The casino is not good, but we were not interested and never even went inside. There is a wonderful bar and live music at the Old San Juan next door or try the Ritz two blocks down. Their pools and beach areas are nice but smaller. We will go back and maybe explore diving on the other side of the island. Everything moves at a slower pace there, be patient and enjoy. The only rude people we saw were other tourists. A great trip... many adventures or just sit and read by the pool or beach....Austin, Texas  
<Date>Dec 28, 2004

<Author>Bubbala
<Content>Loved the InterContinental Everything was great here. Staff is excellent, very friendly and professional. Great service. Beach and pool areas are great. No complaints. Would stay here again. You should rent a car if you want to travel alot. It's a $16 taxi ride into Old San Juan. $10 from airport. Taxis are okay if you are planning to go into Old San Juan once or twice, but if you want to go frequently (like every night for dinner), rent a car. There are other places to go and visit nearby where you don't need a car, such as The Westin and other hotels closeby where there are bars, clubs and restaurants, if you want to go somewhere different than InterContinental.

<Author>idratherbetraveling
<Content>Beautiful place! We loved the Intercontinental! Beautiful location, right on the miles-long, gorgeous beach with comfy  clean chaise lounges at the very tropical pool area. Lovely  clean rooms (with no bugs!!!), large-sized with a lot of amenities, including fridge, couch and nice-sized bathroom area. Great food; we ate at the Italian and Japanese restaurants and the breakfast buffet, they were definitely worth the price. We had excellent and attentive service from everyone. I am a very light sleeper and was never awoken by the planes, I only noticed a couple flying over head during our 3-day stay. This is where we will stay our next time in San Juan. Taxis are very easy to get around in and are price regulated. We also stayed at the Wyndham Condado and were VERY disappointed! There is no comparison between the two. Stay here!

<Author>MITIJ
<Content>relaxed at the intercontinental Jin, the front desk clerk,did everything to get us a very nice room with a very nice view. he succeeded. the beach was glorious and the staff was very pleasant and friendly, tho' my husband noted that once a staff member was not at their job, they were not very friendly, as opposed to what we find at other caribbean destinations, where smiles and hi are the norm. but at their posts they are a very friendly staff. the rooms are very nice, clean and modern, but very much a typical hotel room. our view from the 14th floor was awesome. we had breakfasts and lunches at the intercontinental. dinners we went next door to the el san juan. the italian restaurant was fabulous-we ate there 3 nights, lobster risotto was out of this world. the mexican restaurant was very good also-10th floor-and with thunder and lightening that night-we were graced with a fabulous light show. we also ate at metropol-a very good puerto rican restaurant. i would have gone back again, but we never had a chance. great island-but san juan proper wouldn't be my first choice with children. this was just a vacation for my husband and me-1st week in november

<Author>Trude
<Content>Great Vacation! We just returned from a 4 day stay at the IC and can not understand what the previous post is talking about. Our vacation was great. We were never charged a mandatory bellman fee, have no idea what that is! The bellman were always at the door with a smile and friendly hello and always opened the door for us. Security, also, was not an issue for us. In fact, we ran the beach every morining and upon returning to the hotel, there was always a fresh towel and cold bottle of water waiting for us at the entrance from the beach.We were upgraded to an oceanview room (10th floor) and it was lovely. Balcony was a tad bit small but the view more than made up for it. Pool and beach were great. Drinks were a bit overpriced but really normal for any resort in the Carribean. Every meal we had there was delicious. We ate at several restaurants at the El San Juan and all were great.Staff at the IC were wonderful. ALways greeted you with a smile, and were more than willing to help in any way. Pool bar staff was great. Hi to Miguel and Danny and Rosie! I am sure that there are some people that have to find something to complain about no matter where they are. We found the whole experience to be great and look forward to our next trip there.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Horrible service, horrible casino, HORRIBLE HOTEL The Intercontinental in San Juan was the worst experience I have ever had. About 30 of our friends all went down for a wedding and we all stayed at the hotel. You are charged a mandatory fee for bellmen that stand there chatting instead of opening the door for you. The casino is a JOKE. I dropped $1000 the first night there and had to BEG to get a drink. Then, they didn't want to give my wife a drink because she wasn't playing even though I was betting enough for both of us. The best thing was the dealers in the casino starting talking in spanish about us, and little did they know I speak spanish so I just sat and listened for a while. The security there will annoy the hell out of you. You can't leave your own hotel and come back in without being harrassed. If you go to the pool with one of there $5 can of cokes, they will make you throw it in the trash even though the rules poolside says NO GLASS, nothing about cans. Several of our friends were booked to stay there a week and paid a $250 fee to the airlines just so they could leave early. We will NEVER return there again. When we complained to the corp. office, we were told that they contacted the hotel and they had no record of any of this. How convenient. If you are looking for a HORRIBLE time, look no further.  
<Date>Oct 27, 2004

<Author>mar_76
<Content>Pretty good place Overall, this place was good. Not outstanding, but a perfectly fine place to stay while in San Juan. Very long wait to check-in, but other than that, no service problems. The hotel is nice looking, although the casino is a little worn. The rooms were on the small side and not impressive, but were adequate. We actually thought the rooms would be a bit nicer, based on other Intercontinentals we had stayed at. There were no robes. The pool/beach area was the best part of the hotel. We didn't really use the pool (but it looked nice), but the beach is very nice. Maybe not the best beach in the caribbean, but I thought the sand was fine and the water great. Good temperature, relatively calm, and while not crystal clear, not too murky either. The hotel provides beach chairs at no extra cost. Not sure about umbrellas, but there is shade at the back of the beach. It is a public beach, but this was not at all a problem --- no annoying vendors, etc. The hotel also has a nice little fitness center, no extra charge. When I was researching this trip, I decided to stay in Isla Verde because everyone said it had a better beach than the Condado area, and in this respect, I was not dissapointed. However, a definite drawback of Isla Verde is its isolation. There are not that many restaurants, other than the overpriced hotel offerings. We didn't have bad food at the hotels, but it was nothing to write home about either. Condado has more restaurants, and is closer to Old San Juan. However, if the beach is important to you, Isla Verde is your best bet.  
<Date>Oct 21, 2004

(breakfast buffet for three was aprox. $60.00) She really tried to make it better; It waisted an entire day getting settled. I would definitely think twice before booking this hotel again.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The Most Terrible Hotel Experience We stayed at the Intercontinental in May 2004 for three days prior to our cruise that was departing San Juan on May12th. We had a Club Level poolside suite! It was no bigger than an average size hotel room. It had no bathtub, just a shower. The location of the room was great, but that was the only aspect of our stay that was great. On the first night, our A/C was not working, we called the front desk and they sent maintenance 2 hours later. He could not fix it, but he could not speak English either, we could not communicate with him, so we just showed him the door to please leave our room. We called back down to the desk and asked to be moved, they informed us in a very rude manner that the hotel was currently full. So, we suffered the heat for three nights, and made the best of our stay, we had no choice. The pool  beach were very nice areas. The beach had chairs and umbrellas that you could rent for $10 each. So $30 later, we were set up on the beach. Even though you pay extra for this service... We were still charged a $40 per day RESORT FEE at check out. I demanded to know what this covered, if it did not cover beach chairs or umbrellas. I was told that it was for security personnel b/c the resort was experiencing security problems. This was scary.... We ate at Ruth Chris', and it did not compare to any others we have eated at, the service was horrible, and food was no better than any other chain staekhouse. It was hard to eat lunch anywhere! The food places had very wierd operating hours. Lunch was terrible when we did find a place open, we ate the same cheeseburger three days in a row. There were no options!!! Overall, it was a very expensive, very over-priced, terrible, hot stay. I regret the day I ever booked this hotel. We are Platinum Priority Card holders and thought that this hotel chain was Holiday Inn's luxury hotel chain. But this was not the case. I have stayed at many other Holiday Inns that were so much better quality and a fraction of the cost. We had used a credit card to pay balance at check out. When I returned home, I did contested all charges, but the hotel would not credit anything back, even though our A/C did not work. I hoped that they would give me at the very least a partial credit for no A/C. I will never stay at an Intercontinental Hotel ever again, nor will I recommend it to friends and family. We travel 4 weeks a year to various places and have stayed in many hotels over the years, and this was by far was our worst stay ever!!!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>An Exceptional Experience at the InterContinental San Juan I recently returned from an exceptional stay at the InterContinental San Juan (8/17-8/25). The hotel was lovely and very well maintained. It was worth it to forfeit the city view junior suite that was originally reserved for a room on the 14th floor with a magnificent ocean view. The pool area is beautiful and relaxing, with access to a pristine beach just steps away. Dining at the hotel is excellent. The breakfast buffet at La Terraza is wonderful and worth waking up for. For dinner, Passagio is highly recommended with a lobster ravioli entree that is outstanding. The entire staff is professional, courteous, and attentive to every detail. Elaine and Victor at the front desk are welcoming and accomodating to every need. Samantha, a server in the pool area is delightful. However, Miguel, the manager of La Terraza deserves the most recognition. He is amazingly kind and helpful and truly an asset to the hotel. Puerto Rico was absolutely beautiful and I would love to go back one day.

<Author>lass=
<Content>Great location, great facilities, excellent staff We stayed at the Intercontinental from 8/21 to8/24. On our arrival we received great service from the concierges on duty. Both of them helped in getting an excellent room for us. We began with Nestor who worked so hard to help us and were joined by his associate who did his utmost to help us out.  We were pleased with all aspects of the hotel.Some are mentioned in previous reviews listed before. The lagoon like pool with the beach after is a real plus. All staff were attentive from security to the valet parking. We did not eat at the hotel as we were interested in local less expensive cuisine. There are many places in the area. One in particular run by people from San Juan was called Mi Casita. It is across the street from the hotel and offered breakfast specials for $ 2.50 and reasonably priced dinners in the afternoon. Open 7 am. - 4 p.m. If you choose to see more of Puerto Rico I would suggest renting a car and visiting Luquillo beach and El Yunque rain forest. About an hour or so on Route 26 East from the hotel area. We also made the drive south to Ponce on route 52. It took about 1 1/2 hours from San Juan. There is a free trolley tour that leaves every half hour or so from the Plaza Delicias in the center of old Ponce. The people there, as is true of most of Puerto Rico, were very friendly and proud of their city. On the trolley we met a retired policeman who enriched our trip by telling us so much about Ponce and its history. He wasn't a guide but rather taking the tour with his grandson. We met so many helpful people like him on the trip. While in San Juan you may want to take advantage of the ferry to Catano. It cost fifty cents. Not a bad price for a ride across San Juan Bay. Once you get to Catano you can take a cab for about two dollars per person to the Bacardi Rum plant for a free tour. Of course they promote it endlessly but at the end you get two free drinks and the tour is fun. The ferry leaves from Pier 2. This is the pier before the cruise ship terminal. There is a parking garage in back of the bus terminal nearby. I would not hesitate to return to San Juan, the hotel was great and the people were friendly.  
<Date>Aug 26, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Wonderful Vacation! The Intercontinental is absolutely beautiful! From the moment you pull up to the hotel you're welcomed with beautiful plantings, trees, a waterfall, etc. The hotel itself is clean; everyone (for the most part) is very friendly  helpful, the pool area is gorgeous surrounded by a beautiful courtyard, fountain, many beach chairs, swim up bar, waterfall, jacuzzi, etc. It really was great! The beach was nice, pretty empty  quiet while I was there (8/15-21) but it gave me the chance to relax  enjoy the beach without distraction. The first night we stayed in a damp, musty, mildewy room (1119)  we complained  they moved us to another room which was perfect. The rooms are very nice with modern furniture, the bathroom was clean, the balcony was small but served its purpose. The location is nice but somewhat far...I thought Isla Verde was nearby to downtown San Juan. It's not. Don't get me wrong, the location is great, being that you have a nice shopping plaza across the street with a Super Market, a great, affordable restaurant Mi Casita  more. You can take the bus to Old San Juan for .25 cents but it takes about 40 minutes or so. The cab fare, I heard, was $16 each way. The bus really wasn't bad at all. Old San Juan was awesome, beautiful buildings, historic sites, a must see! I would def. stay at the Intercontinental again, it really is a nice, well-maintained hotel. If you've ever been to Cancun, the Intercontinental is comparable to the Palace resorts. Try the Pina Coladas, they're delicious! Enjoy =)  
<Date>Aug 24, 2004
