<Author>Lvega718
<Content>Don't understand the negative reviews My friends and I just retruned from a 5 day stay at te Intercontinental. We were a little nervous after reading some of the negative reviews but after our experience I would not only stay there again, I would recommend the hotel to anyone interested in staying in Isla Verde. The rooms are average size / decor but very clean. Terraces are very small but the the view was spectacular. The staff was extremely friendly (with the exception of one person by the pool who was INCREDIBLY rude!) and willing to help you with anything. The pool and beach were clean and beautiful. Security guards were constantly making rounds but they were also extremely friendly and not a nuisance at all. The dress code was a little strict but nothing to complain about. There is a lower level that will take you right to the pool which alleviates this problem. The drinks were great, you must try a Voodoo Juice (delicious!). Can't give much of an opinion about the food other than it was expensive. However, if you're looking to eat real Puerto Rican food like we were you'll probabably skip the hotel returants all together.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Beautiful! I just got back from a 4 night visit to San Juan . We stayed at the Intercontinential and overall it was a great experience. The resort itself was very nice and atmosphere was great. The pools were big and nice. I loved the rocks waterfall and the hot tub. It was just a big pool. There are no kiddy pool but the water was just 3'6 so it wasn't so bad. There were plenty of cushion chairs all over the swimming area. The beach was beautiful and clean. There was security which I thought was tight and a great idea. You had to wear a wrist band (which is a different color everyday) to go to the pool or beach. You also will need that to get towels. The service was great, especially the concierge. I got to meet Nester, which was a pleasure. He was very helpful and he's probably reading this (Hi Nester, I'm the lady that you helped on my birthday and told you about this website! by the way, Happy Belated Bday to you also!). Nestor was very helpful in helping me getting another room. I saw his name badge and told him how I heard about him and about this website. The other lady with the short brown hair and the chief concierge (which I didn't get names)were all very helpful and great with giving us directions. So I thought the concierge was exceptional! The bellman and the valet parking guys were great too. They opened the doors for you and made you feel like royalty. I had to kids with us and they were very nice about it. Although, I would say that this is definitely not a kid friendly hotel. My boy was playing in the lobby and the head security guy had to come get us to take him away. The pools close at 7pm which I thought was pretty early compare to the resorts in the US. It gets pretty dark early there also. The casino was small but had all the tables. There was also poker tournaments being held weekly (I think). I went during the day and the way they played blackjack is so different from casinos here. The dealer only get one card which he flips for us to see, but he doesn't get a second card until the entire table is done so it's so hard to win. My husband said at night they play the regular blackjack way..so I'm all confused. Oh the dealers do not smile or talk or even say hi to you. They are like a standing robot..no emotions at all!! The dealers that I had forgot to flip her cards a few tiimes and we had to remind her and they even hit for you not evening seeing if you want to hit or not. .it's an automatic thing.. how funnyMy only complaint is the rooms was on the small side especially the bathroom and the bedspread had fuzz balls all over it, so do not sleep on it! I'm not sure if it has ever been cleaned! There are many restaurants in walking distant: BK, pizza hut, wendy's, KFC, churches, dominos, ponderosa, and many others if you don't want to eat at the hotel. I must say if you are a wing lover like I am, try the baseballl wings at Lupis which is just past Wydham El San Juan hotel. It's really reasonalbe priced and good. A lot of people do not speak English so make sure you know what you're ordering and where you're going. We had trouble with the language barrier. Old San Juan is a must see..very beautiful but had problem parking. It's a pain to find parking space and the driving lane is BAD!!! so be careful. It's so tight and they are really bad drivers. The rainforest is also a must see.. make sure you have tennis and ready to walk.Overall, we will return one day again. The hotel was nice with exception the rooms...  
<Date>Aug 12, 2004

<Author>NYDAWG
<Content>Great Hotel My fiance and I just got back from PR and the Intercontinental San Juan was great; whoever had anything negative to say must have stayed somewhere else. The pool and the beach were beautiful and clean. The staff for the most part was very friendly and the security is tight. If possible, we highly recommend a room on the ocean side (not the city) - the view was awesome. We got lucky because we booked through Expedia and there's no guarantees on what room you get; we had 14th floor oceanview! Our only complaint on the hotel was that the restaurants were extremely expensive, particulary the casual dining (breakfast and lunch). We're talking about $10 eggs, burgers and dogs! We recommend eating across the street at the shopping center. Mi Casita is a great place for breakfast and affordable (never had lunch or dinner there). But there other fast food places and eateries like Ponderosa or Pizza Hut for lunch. There are many other nice restaurants in the other hotels and surrounding area that are affordable for dinner such as Outback in Embassy Suites, Tequila in the El San Juan (right next door), and Sonny's which is at the end of the beach. We do suggest dinner at the Japanese Restaurant in the Intercontinental - it was a good time. We obviously did not stay during the busy season, so not sure if the service is the same during that time period. We would definitely go back and try to recruit some friends to come as well.Side note: Make sure you ask the taxi driver how much $ before you get in. The rates seemed to vary a couple of times from driver to driver.

<Author>Italianprincess85
<Content>Beautiful hotel and wonderful service I just got back from Puerto Rico and the Inter-Continental hotel. We had a shaky start to out visit when our toilet overflowed, but the hotel took care of that immediately and moved us to an even better room. The next day they brought my husband and I a tray of cheese and fruit with crackers and a bottle of wine for the trouble we had the day before. That was a very nice touch and really impressed us. All the grounds of the hotel are beautiful and clean. The pool and beach are wonderful and so was the spa where we got massages.Our only complaint was the entertainment in Puerto Rico. They don't play anything but Salsa and that can get boring after a while. We like all different kinds of music and just hearing salsa all the time really bored us. We also would have liked to have seen a show, but there are no shows of any kind in Puerto Rico. I asked and the only answer I was given was go next door to the El San Juan and watch the salsa contest. That was not what we wanted to see. I think all of Puerto Rico could benefit by adding some kind of shows to their hotels for the entertainment of guests because not everyone is a fan of salsa or wants to listen to it constantly.As for the restaurant MiCasita that I heard so many things about. Well my husband ordered the mofongo to try and it was just terrible. Even the octupus salad he ordered was terrible. Thank god I got shrimp because you can't ruin shrimp that much. I would not recommend Mi Casita to anyone we both thought it was terrible and my husband will eat anything and he didn't eat that mofongo. Stick to the restaurants in the hotel they are terrific. We ate at Passagio and the food was so good that you wanted to lick you plate. Just stay away from MiCasita across the street.Old San Juan was quaint and cute and we bought some jewelry and souveneirs there and enjoyed the history so that is a place to see. Sorry we couldn't be more positive about Puerto Rico and this has nothing to do with the hotel because it is first rate.  
<Date>Aug 2, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Excellant Stayed at the IC in late June. Hotel is very nice and is minutes from the airport. The airplanes are not that close to be noisy. Hotel has a Ruth Chris which we went to and was excellant. We also tried the Japanese restaurant for sushi which was also good.The pool is large and very nice with a swim up bar. The beach is right off the pool and is really nice. You can walk next door about 100 yards to the Wyndham El San Juan. They have 4 or 5 excellant restaurants including The Palm.Overall one of the nicest hotels we saw in PR. If I went back I would stay at the IC or El San Juan. Be carefull there are other Wyhdhams in PR, you want the El San Juan, not the Condado!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Nice, pleasant place Stayed in June 2004. All around a very pleasant stay. Swim up bar and general pool area is clean and attractive. The beach is not the best, but that is due to the hotel's location in Isla Verde. The rooms are small but cozy, with nice looking furniture and a small terrace. The casino is small, but adequate for the hotel guests. Casino equipment is ill maintained, particularly the video poker machines, which are in short supply, and half of them don't work. There is food, ashes, cigarette butts, and some garbage on the machines and the surrounding area. Definitely need to clean up the casino. The staff is pleasant. My only complaint is the $75 hold put on my credit card per room in case I incurred any charges during my stay, that I would not have money with which to cover at the end of my stay. My credit card was close to max, and the pre-charge took me over the max, preventing me from making purchases on the card. Had I been forewarned, I would have taken another card. Beachside restaurant food was nice but a bit pricey (their $12, so-called 1/4 pound hamburger is closer to 1/8 of a pound). Also, too many mosquitos. If you rent a car, the parking for the hotel is across the street and it's $10 per day. Lots of inexpensive eating options in the neighborhood.  
<Date>Jul 23, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not bad for Puerto Rico resort hotel The hotel is best for those who are light sleepers (noisy given the airport), rise early, and spend most of the day at the pool, beach, or fitness center. These hotel attributes are wonderful, and the pool is one of the better ones I've encountered in my travels. The gym equipment is not exactly new, but the view of the beach compensates for their age. The room is standard with no frills, but that is fine if you are out at the pool or Old San Juan anyway. The staff is not rude, but they are also not generally friendly or accommodating (I have no complaints or general complements). I got a good rate, and, at a similar rate, would stay there again. Interesting note: An elderly couple staying at the Wyndham wished to see our room for a future stay in San Juan. They said the room was nice, and commented that the IC rooms are much newer than the rooms in the Wyndham. I have heard much about the need for the Wyndham next door to refurbish and modernize their room.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>What you see..is what you get. The hotel grounds were beautiful! The hotel was clean and the rooms were very nice. Some of the staff was very friendly but some of them were not and when you asked them questions about the hotel itself...they didn't know about their own hotel!This was a bit frustrating. The casino is small but entertaining, men must wear pants at night. Puerto Rico itself was very pretty but pricey. Renting a car is definately a must and it's very easy to drive and get around in Puerto Rico. In Old San Juan parking was a nightmare so you may have to walk but it's worth walking around. The forts were very stunning and worth going to. It's nice to take a map and explore the beaches some of them are not crowded and the water was nice and warm. El Yunque Rainforest has a good hike to one of the waterfalls but definately take your tennis shoes it's slippery and alot of people were wearing sandals and complained of it being to slippery. Overall the people are not all that friendly in Puerto Rico but the good thing is most everyone speaks english so communication is not an issue. Overall Puerto Rico is a beautiful place, lots of places to see and I will go back.  
<Date>Jul 14, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Vacation I statyed at the Intercontinental with my family of 8 from June 19 through the 26th and we could not have had a more wonderful experience. Before we even arrived at the hotel, I contacted the hotel directly and requested rooms facing the ocean on the same floor and we received them. By calling the hotel directly, I was also able to get a terrific rate for one of their suites for me and my wife. I also spoke to the conceirge, Nestor, before we arrived and he was able to arrange for a van for us for the week (somethig I recommend if you paly golf-Dorado is 30 minutes west) or sight seeing ( The rain forest and old San Juan). The staff was great; the casino intimate; and the food good. Ruth Chis's was ok; the japanese place fun. I have four kids ages 18 through 22 who found the night life great in the Isla Verde section. The property is secure and safe; the rooms (we were on the 16th-top floor) clean and nicely decorated; the pool and beach area fantastic (plenty of chairs); and the fitness center, steam and suana more than adequate. Tip: Try the spa. Great thing about the hotel was it was across the street from a market so we saved money on soda etc; and were able to walk to nearby restraunts where the food was excellent. We will definitely go back.

<Author>LQGuy
<Content>No major complaints here We stayed at this hotel last summer. The positives seemed to outweigh the negatives for us. Negatives...the lobby furniture was rather worn, and needs to be updated. Food was just a little pricey, but not outrageous. The hotel is located near the airport, so you can hear the roar of plane engines as they take off.Neutral...the room was neither horrible, nor fantastic. It was an average room you might get at a Westin, Crown Plaza, Hilton, etc.Positives....beautiful pool area with swim-up bar. We found the beach to be immaculate when we were there, along with feeling safe. The food was pretty good (not spectacular, but not horrible either). We found the staff to be friendly.  Overall, while the Wyndam also looked nice, we wouldn't hesitate to return here either.

<Author>dej
<Content>Disagree with Brooklyn reviewer I have to disagree with the Brooklyn review. Were we staying at the same hotel??? We knew ahead of time that the taxes are 20%, something you should have asked prior to your reservations. They are not hidden charges if you do your homework and ask in advance. We thought the staff was wonderful, very friendly and helpful. Infact, we kept saying thru out our stay how friendly everyone was that worked there. The concierge, Nestor, was the best. We used our Priority Points and were upgraded upon check in to Ocean front room. He gave us maps and directions to all of our sightseeing destinations. We had an extended check out also. We thought the pool was clean and the drink staff and security around the pool were very friendly. WE had a birthday dinner for my husband at Ruth's Chris was was astounding, food and service was excellent. There is also another good restaurant called Passagio and we were given VIP service. We walked over to the El San Juan and weren't too impressed with the decor, very dark. We weren't allowed into the casino because we were too casual??? We did eat at both restaurants on the 10th floor at the El San Juan, very good and casual. Drinks are expensive and so is food, but that comes with vacationing. I don't know why you think El San Juan is excellent, it seemed average to us. We thought the Intercontinental was by far the nicest hotel in Isla Verde and The Ritz was nice too. Funny how we had different reviews for the same hotel, same time. Wonder why?

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>THE WORST SERVICE I just returned from a trip to Puerto Rico June 2004. I have been to Puerto Rico numerous times and stayed at the El San Juan(which is excellent). This time I stayed at the Intercontinental, the staff ruined our vacation. First beware of hidden charges like beach taxes and pool maintance fees. The pool was dirty so I do not know who is keeping the maintance money!! The pool closed early on a Saturday for a private party. I also purchased a raft at the hotel store and they said it was ok to use at the pool. On Sunday I was asked to take it out of the pool because there was too many people. The maid service is terrible if they bother to come at all. The concierge desk had to be the worst of all the employees. We were charged extra for someone else's room that was friends of ours. Since the hotel didnt bill them for a 4th person and they left earlier. They decided to charge my room because someone had to pay as I was told. I spent my last day of my vacation fighting charges that didnt belong to my room. After several employees told me they would take care of this. And nothing was ever done. They will not even give you extended check out. Even the Ruth Chris restaurant at the hotel had flys in their water!! This was the worst hotel experience due to the hotel staff. The casino workers are very nice (obviously). And the towel lady was nice at the pool. Basically if you are looking for a hotel that does not value their guests then stay at the Intercontiental

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Nice getaway My wife and I used Priority Club Points for a stay last week. We were pleasantly suprised by the quality of the hotel. Our checkin was smooth and wre were given a ocean front room on the 11th floor. The room was clean and nicely furnished with a King size bed and a fold out couch. Teh small balcony was large enough for one of us to sit. We spent most of our time on the beach and by the pool sipping rum runners and pina coladas. There was no fee for using the beach chairs or towells as someone reported earlier. We did not find the wristbands to be of any hindrance. In fact, we like dthe fact that they kept outsiders from wandering into the pool area. The beaches were clean and we were not hasseled by vendors, although there were plenty of folks offering drinks and other refreshements.Directly across the street from th ehotel is a small shopping center with all of the necessities, a supermarket, Subway, gift shop, and a nice cafe, Mi Casista, for an economical breakfast. I was able to but beer at teh supermarket and using a small cooler, drink it poolside or on the beach with no hassles. This was a great way to keep the spending down (Especially at $5/beer or $8-10 for a frozen cocktail). The pool waitresses were excellent, especially Rosie.We did not eat any meals at the hotel restraunts. We had a nice dinner at The Palm at the ESJ and anoth night ate at the Japanese Resturant at ESJ. Both were good though pricey. We also ate one night at Lupi's Mexican Place down the street and it was of good quality and we enjoyed the outdoor dining. We usually ate leftovers or Subway for lunch.Did not spend any time in the IC casino, but did manage to lose a few bucks at the ESJ casino. The ESJ is definitell more hapening at night and we would people watch in the lobby. At the sugestion of Jozell, the excellent consierge, we went on a kayaking trip to see the bioluminescent bay at Cabeza de San Juan. It was memorable experience and well worth the $70/person. The forts at Old San Juan were nice, but the area itself was too much like Charleston, Savanah, or new Orleans to be unique to us. We would definitely go back to San Juan and the Intercontintal again.  
<Date>Jun 14, 2004

<Author>chrissyf
<Content>Great Isla Verde Hotel We stayed at the Intercontinental over Memorial Day weekend and it was great. The oceanfront/poolfront rooms are an adequate size, although the bathroom is tiny. The pool area is very nice - with both covered and sunny areas - perfect if you want to keep your kids in the shade while you catch some rays. Although not really advertised on their website, there is a decent oceanfront fitness area and a spa, where both my husband and I enjoyed our treatments. The only restaurants we tried were the Ciao Mediterrean Cafe and Momoyama (japanese). The service at the Ciao Cafe was horribly slow every single time we ate there, although the food was fine for poolside/beachside. It is especially nice to get a drink at the cafe (which is right on the beach) at sunset. The sushi from Momoyama was delicious, albeit pricey. We also tried Mi Casita across the street for very cheap breakfasts. The casino was smaller than the Wyndham El San Juan but perfect for light gamblers - and the slot machines at IC really do pay - I won $750 at the IC slots!! The Wyndham El San Juan is right next door and the Italian restaurant La Picola Fontina was terrific. The Wyndham El San Juan is quite a scene on the weekends and it was great fun to visit the lobby bar and people watch. But the weekend bar crowd at the El San Juan was a bit rowdy - with the partying going on all night and some people actually sleeping at the El San Juan pool area. We were very happy to retreat back to the IC after visiting the El San Juan scene. The security at IC was very effective and would not have allowed revelers to sleep overnight at the IC pool. We thought IC was a good choice for families even though it didn't really have a kiddie pool - only a very shallow end of the regular pool. No one charged us for towels or chairs and there did not seem to be any 8am rush to reserve pool chairs. There was ample supply of chairs.We had our nicest meal at Ramiro's in Condado where the food and service was the most fantasic I have had in a long while. The staff at Ramiro's was so accomodating it was incredible. We arrived at the restaurant and our 13 month old baby was sleeping and, of course, we had left our stroller in our hotel room. The host offered us a semi-private room and actually made a cushioned bed on the floor (with mutiple fine tableclothes) for the baby to sleep while we ate. When the baby woke up, the host brought a real highchair - not one of those wooden generic highchairs, but the type of high chair you'd have in your home. The waiters at Ramiro's were also excellent - suggesting many off-the-menu options and were amenable to all sorts of specific food requests (low salt/low carb/no dairy). If you visit San Juan, definitely stop in Ramiro's for an unforgettable meal.We also visited El Yunque (the rainforest) which was about an hour away. We rented a car and drove ourselves. It was very beautiful, but I would recommend sneakers or other shoes with great traction and absolutely no strollers - the whole hike was extremely slippery. We took the baby in a baby backpack carrier on the shortest hike to La Mina Falls - which was very scenic and about 35 mins down and 25 mins back up. Renting a car was a good choice for us as it can be $15 each way to Condado or Old San Juan, which adds up fast. The valet parking at IC was not cheap though - $16/night. The hotel boasts onsite Avis car rental, but the Avis station was really offsite - you had to take shuttle bus to rent a car so it was not as convenient as it sounded. Still, the concierge and staff at IC were very helpful. We will definitely return to IC.  
<Date>Jun 8, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Enjoyable if Expensive The Intercontinental was enjoyable. The staff were friendly and the concierge was very helpful. The rooms were unimpressive, but we spent most of our time outside having fun anyway. The beach was clean and the water was great for my psoraisis. The hotel was very relaxed and quiet, and for clubs, nightlife, etc, you can always walk next door to the Wyndham (which is much more expensive, BTW).Isla Verde is not near most of the sights, and I recommend taking the bus to get out to Old San Juan, etc. Taxis to Old San Juan are nearly $20; while the bus is 25 cents. The bus ride is about 30 minutes. The local restaurants are brutally expensive. Expect to pay $100 for two at mid-priced restaurants. I recommend Metropol, if you're interested in something more representative of local cuisine, and you want to save a few bucks. Ciao Mediterranean Cafe is also nice, and right on the beach, if you want to save $.We booked the trip with Expedia and I would advise against selecting in advance their prepackaged tours (i.e., bus trips to El Yunque Rain Forest, etc.). The company handling the tour was very disorganized and unclear about when (or whether) the tour would even take place, even two days after we had already gotten to Puerto Rico. The hotel has a company on site that will guarantee that your tour will take place. I would also advise against taking a tour to Luquillo Beach. The grounds were a mess, and the bathrooms were unsanitary.  
<Date>May 12, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Absolutely beautiful!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We stayed at the Intercontinental for one night at the end of a cruise we took in March. I LOVE THIS HOTEL! For the brief version, gorgeous grounds, absolutely relaxing, very secure, on the beach, swim up bar, nice room, great pina coladas, close to airport without hearing airport noises, etc.Longer version: I would consider myself to be extremely picky when it comes to hotel rooms. I couldn't find anything wrong with the room. It was very clean and had a gorgeous view out of the balcony overlooking the ocean. (Okay, if I have to admit something I read on trip advisor before going to San Juan, it did have a slight musky smell, which according to reviews on trip advisor, EVERY HOTEL DOES. It is the caribbean and is to be expected It certainly wasn't bad enough to make me not want to stay here.)In total honesty, we enjoyed the hotel so much that we are wanting to go back as soon as we can. The only thing we were disappointed in was that we were stupid enough to take a Carnival cruise instead of staying at the Intercontinental for the entire week. The pool area is absolutely beautiful. I think I read somewhere else that the security around the pool was annoying. I have to say that it was actually a good thing for me because I felt very secure.The Intercontinental is definitely somewhere I will go back to. In fact, originally when I first read comments on trip advisor, had I not booked through Hotwire, I would not have chosen this hotel. However, now, after actually staying there and seeing how wonderful it is, I will be booking directly through the hotel out of fear to not get to stay in this hotel again.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Easter Vacation I stayed at the Hotel with my wife and two teenage sons. The hotel facilities are excellent and the concierges were extremely helpful with dinner reservations and restaurant recommendations. Iwas borned in the island and have stayed in many resorts in PR. <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Family Friendly and Safe My family spent 4 nites at the Intercontinental Easter Weekend. It was wonderful!! We were traveling with my mother and wanted connecting rooms. Although the manager could care less and did nothing to honour our request, the gentleman (Cliff) at the front desk was wonderful and worked hard to make it happen. The conecierge was also great, offering information on how to get to the Rainforest and securing us a minivan. All of the staff that we came in contact with were very friendly including bartenders, waitstaff at restaurants, pool attendents, and housekeeping. All went out of their way to entertain our children ages 4 and 6. There was an ample supply of towels at the pool, plenty of chairs comfortably spaced, and everything was clean (I'm big on that). Security was very good as the hotel supplied wrist bands to assure that the pool grounds were used only by hotel guests. There was an army of friendly security personel, they were dressed nicely in suits (not like police) and helped to make my family feel safe. There were waitresses from the hotel offering to bring drinks and food out to guests on the public beach that is in front of the hotel. There were plenty of chairs on the beach for hotel guests. We wanted for nothing except our drinks which took forever at Chao Medditeranean the beach bar/restuarant. The rest of the food including room service was resort expensive, but very good. Easter brunch was very good but extremely overpriced at 38.00 pp. C'mon it's a buffet! Despite the price we enjoyed ourselves as there was a traditional Puerto Rican music and dance show and my children had a blast at the Easter Egg Hunt where they were given baskets and found tons of candy and egg shaped sidewalk chalk. WED RETURN IN A HEARTBEAT!!! WISH I COULD HAVE STAYED LONGER!!  
<Date>Apr 18, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>InterContinental was amazing! I CAME ON THIS SITE about a week ago to read the comments on the IC and was shocked to read such horrible things about the place i was preparing to visit. Then as i scrolled down i read more comments that made me think if these people stayed at the same place. One new yorker made the IC sound like complete trash and a waste of time and money, while a person from Boston (a former NYer) made the IC sound amazing. Now that i came home from my relaxing, and amazing vacation in San Juan from the IC i have to say, I DISAGREE WITH ANYONE WHO SAYS THE IC IS TRASH, CAUSE I HAD THE MOST AMAZIN TIME, from the friendly staff, to the dancing and live music at the pool on Easter Sunday, I dont know what else someone could ask for. There was the beach directly behind the hotel, a casino inside, beautiful landscape, delicious restaurants right down stairs, and the staff that helped set up excursions. My family and I went to the El Yunque Rainforest, we hiked up and down beatuiful open wildlife, natural habitats to home for many species, not to mention the dip we took in the natural pool at the bottom of a water fall. San Juan had and has so much to offer, the weather was beautiful, i woke up put on a bathing suit, headed to breakfast, sat outside, and realized this was heaven. The tiny amount of rain was in the morning on one of the days i was there but other then that it was always SUNNY and warm. The beverages alcoholic and non, were a great addition to lounging in the sun, while reading the book i brought down with me. My parents enjoyed every moment of the trip, my grandmother found things to do, as well as my sister. No matter what age you are, or as large as the family and friends you plan on traveling with, Intercontinental should be your top choice. You are situated next to the El San Juan Wyndam, which is more fancy and maybe larger with the casino and lobby, but i found the IC to be more comfortable, less like a fashion show, and more like the laps of luxury. I believe anyone who says the IC is not one of the best places to stay, is lying, because i can't imagine ever staying anywhere else. IC made my vacation PERFECT!  
<Date>Apr 12, 2004

<Author>American-n-Germany
<Content>InterContinental - - The Best My wife, my son, and I decided to go to Puerto Rico and we stayed at the InterContinental. It was totally AWESOME. We had a room overlooking the pool/ocean. The rooms are really nice, clean, and spacious. The hotel is close to the airport which is convienient yet we never really notice any aircraft noise. The best part of the stay was the hotel staff. From check in to departure everyone was friendly, courteous, professional, and they take care of their guest. The InterContinental is in a great location with everything you could possibly want and/or need inside the hotel or right outside the hotel (fine dining, fast foods, shops, grocery store, bus stop, etc.). If you are going to Puerto Rico, the InterContinental is the place to stay. I read all of the reviews of this hotel before we went to PR and after our return I don't understand how anyone could be negative about the InterContinental. We can't wait to go back to Puerto Rico and of course you know where we are going to stay . . . I'd rate our experience a perfect 10 on a scale of 1-10.

<Author>sandir19
<Content>Great time. My boyfriend and I just came back from a nice trip to San Juan for Valentine's weekend. We both loved it. The Intercontinental was clean, modern, and the staff were very friendly. The hotel food was a bit expensive, but just across the street there is a little shopping center with a grocery store, diner, mexican restaurant, bakery, and baskin robbins, so you don't have to pay the hotel prices the whole trip. The Italian restaurant in the hotel was excellent. The casino is small, but nice for some entertainment. On Sunday afternoons they have a free show of Puerto Rican music and dancing at the pool that I loved. It's a good place to stay if you want a gorgeous pool, easy access to the beach, but a quieter nightlife. You can walk next door to the Wyndam for more nightlife--a dance club, casino, and an amazing lobby with bars and live music. Enjoy!  
<Date>Feb 17, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Would go back in a heartbeat! Wow! I just logged on to write a glowing review of the InterContinental after our 4 night stay there at the beginning of January, and was shocked to read the reviews from the New Yorkers below! Are they sure they stayed at this hotel? Our experience was completely different. We got a great last minute deal on Travelocity two days before our departure ($680/pp, airfare + hotel!) as we were desperately in need of sun  relaxation (not to mention a quick escape from this brutal Boston winter!) We found it, and so much more, at the InterContinental. I was very reluctant to go to San Juan, as our impressions from a quick cruise stop-over years ago were that it was a dirty and crime-ridden island. Boy am I glad we gave it another shot. SJ is not the type of place where you're going to poke around the village and have dinner in town. But if you want amazing weather, a beautiful hotel, and so good ol' fashioned RR, you found the place. We couldn't have been happier with the IC: a fantastic room (totally spotless, btw), great service, a tranquil and beautiful pool, and one of the best beaches I've ever seen. The sand is like baby powder, and unlike other islands in the Carribean, you're totally undisturbed and encouraged to relax. The restaurants at the IC are great. My husband loved Ruth's Chris and we had an amazing meal at the Italian resto on the lower level. The other nights we went to the Wyndham El San Juan for dinner (they have a great Mexican resto overlooking the ocean) and the Ritz Carlton. We thought the IC was FAR nicer than the El San Juan, and while the Ritz is nice, you pay for it -- and their pool chairs are identical to those at the IC! Their casino was great -- and kept hubby occupied while I read by the pool or napped in our room. Not sure what this NYC reviewer means about the hotel being overrun with New Yorkers. Only days earlier we had moved from Manhattan to Boston, and both found it to be quiet and very laid-back. You could always get a great lounge chair at the pool or a seat in the hot tub. The best part of our trip was breakfasts at the buffet (fresh fruit, omlets  waffles to order, friendly service) and lunch by the pool (salads, sandwiches, great lemonade) brought right to your lounge chair. I'd say we're pretty finicky travellers, and not easily satisfied, but we absolutely loved the IC and thought it earned every one of it's 4 stars. If you can get a great deal online like we did -- GO. We spent our honeymoon at the Four Seasons in Maui and agreed that this little trip was equally relaxing, tropical and enjoyable. I can't say enough good things about this place. My parents just booked a 4-day trip to the IC based on our recommendation. You won't be dissapointed in this place. ENJOY!  
<Date>Jan 30, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Nice place, rooms very ordinary We just returned from a 5 night stay, including New Years eve. The best features are the pool area and beach, clean and well kept. The outdoor restaurants and waitress service to your pool chairs was nice and well done. The hotel was relatively quiet, not much to do, except eat and to the casino. However, The Wydham El San Juan is right next door, and a lively place. The rooms were just OK. They seemed on the smallish side, and the bathroom was tight as well. Overall the staff was friendly and attentive. I would look for a hotel with more 'going on the next time.

<Author>Deborah4967
<Content>Excellent hotel The hotel is very elegant, beautiful, up-to-date modern and very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful, without having to continually tip. While eating breakfast there is a little expensive, it was lovely to sit on the terrace in the morning with the birds. The pool area was kept clean throughout the day, and I could only complain about the children swimming and playing in the jacuzzi (against the posted rules). Lunch between the pool and overlooking the public beach was also a daily treat. The beach was clean and the waves calm, but very full of sand and seaweed, so we kept to the pool. While the hotel is only five minutes from the airport, that also means that there was some muffled noise of planes landing throughout the day and evening. My only complaint was that since it was December, the sun disappeared from the pool area at 3:30 each day, but it was still pleasant enough to stay out until 6 when it got dark. The restaurants at the hotel provide variety, but it was also inexpensive and convenient to get out to local restaurants and the concierge helped with reservations. I would definitely stay there again.  
<Date>Dec 29, 2003
